Overall a decent place to be together (atmosphere), but I would not expect the best experience in terms of dining (food & service). I personally would not initiate a get-together here, however I would not discourage to tag-along if it were initiated by others. The atmosphere was easily the best aspect of this restaurant. The lighting, seating arrangement, & noise levels were all respectable. The food was just okay, definitely not up to par with what I would typically expect in the price ranges across the menu. However, there was certainly plenty of variety from pizza to pasta & even meats (fish, steak, etc), but again all well overpriced for their respective portions (especially the entrees). The dough of the pizza was exceptional, however it was a pity that the toppings were significantly over-salted. Unfortunately the service was mediocre at best, & lacked proactivity. It took us well over an hour to have our orders taken (& I really mean taken, not served). Luckily our water was being constantly refilled - I guess we'll take what we can get. IMPORTANT NOTE FOR GIFT CARDS!! They only accept gift cards as a whole, meaning they do not re-gift the remainder. I.e. if your bill is 50$ & you have a 75$ gift card, you would NOT get back a 25$ gift card. This is literally the only restaurant I've ever experienced this situation, & quite ridiculous to be honest. Definitely not at the top of my list for Italian restaurants.View more

A Disappointing Experience at Piatti Restaurant in Laval We recently chose Piatti Restaurant in Laval for a special celebration, but unfortunately, our experience fell far short of expectations. Despite spending a substantial amount, we left feeling thoroughly disappointed. The service was unreasonably slow, with appetizers taking over an hour to arrive. To make matters worse, they were served in batches rather than all at once, causing a disjointed start to our meal. There were also several errors with our orders, & the timing of the main courses was inconsistent-everyone at our table received their dishes at different times. Additionally, we were not informed before the third bottle of wine was opened, yet it was included on our bill. This lack of communication was frustrating & added to our dissatisfaction. Overall, I cannot recommend Piatti for its food or service, especially for larger groups of 10 or more. The food was overpriced & did not deliver in terms of quality or taste, leaving us feeling that our celebration was marred by an overall subpar experience. In conclusion, for the price we paid, we expected far better. We will not be returning, & I would advise others to consider other options if they are looking for a seamless dining experience.

The BEST butcher in the greater Montr√©al area, it's not even close. Very pricey, but you will never regret it. The quality, consistency & diversity of meats & cuts is astonishing. I used to work around here & decided to have a little 5@7 with the old work colleagues here. This used to be the Carlos & Pepe back in the day, but it's been closed since before COVID. It's a downtown bar, so you kinda have to judge it at that level. Are drinks & food kinda pricey? Yeah, but I've seen worse elsewhere in the area. If you're sitting by the window, is it going to be loud/distracting? Yes, but there's plenty of room further back. Is beer selection kinda limited? Yes & no. It's one of those "lots of selection, but not much choice". It's all Labatt products, including the fake microbrews, but my pint of Guinness was fine. Service was good, they were friendly without hovering over us constantly. Apparently there's happy hour specials but we weren't informed about them. I'm sort of torn about the food. I ordered the poutine, my friends went for the burger & fish & chips. As much as their plates were gigantic, mine was kinda small for the price, & shredded cheese on a poutine? Blasphemy! But the fries & sauce were good. Ambiance is nice, it looks a lot like the old McLean's down the road but newer & cleaner, & more TVs. There's literally no bad seat here to watch whatever game is on. So when in the neighborhood I think it's a pretty good place to hang out.View more

I've been twice (once as a table of 2 & another as a table of 4) about a year apart from each other. On both occasions the service was absolutely terrible. This time around we ordered food & drinks. It was a Wednesday night & the restaurant was half empty. The food arrived at our table, & we had to ask our waitress where our drinks were. She didn't even go & make them right away & we were more than halfway through our meal by the time we came out. One drink was even the wrong one. We had ordered virgin & she brought out an alcoholic one & then even tried to charge us for the drink with alcohol, which we had obviously sent back. My partner asked for a knife & never got it, so he couldn't take apart the meat that came with his ramyun. Meanwhile the whole staff is on their phone in the bar in the middle of the restaurant. I wanted to make my soup home, & they didn't even have a takeout container that could hold broth. I had to leave my broth at the restaurant & leave with just noodles. I tried to give this place another shot, but the low quality dining service is just not worth.View more

The lack of empathy, accountability, & basic human decency is honestly shocking. This was hands down the worst dining experience I've ever had. Issue 1 - if you are trying to make a reservation over the phone, forget about it! They do not answer the phone at all. We were a group of 10-12 so we couldn't book online & had to submit a reservation request on their website. We never got a reply back so we tried to call for 4 days with no answer! Voicemail box full.. I literally went to the restaurant in person to make a reservation & that was no issue. I have truly never experience such trouble getting a hold of a restaurant (still was never able to over the phone). Issue 2 - We were excited to drink lots of soju but when we started ordering the waitress informed us that they had no soju! There was a whole section on the menu for soju & sake & no one told us that they didn't have either of those until we started ordering. We ordered some cocktail pitchers instead, which were just fine (not very strong). Issue 3 - There was some water from the ceiling leaking on half of the people of our group so we asked the waitress if she could switch to a different table. She was only able to offer us a separate additional smaller table behind us. This was frustrating as it split our group & we were planning on sharing all of the food we had already ordered as they told us we could only do 1 bill for the group. Each time we got a plate we had to decide which table would get it & we had to pass down some plates back & forth to both table. It was a mess & super inconvenient. About halfway into our meal we were moved once again to a larger table that could fit our whole group. Nothing was offered to us to accommodate for all the inconvenience. I had to ask the waitress if she could possibly offer a discount or free items as we were disappointed with our experience. I even asked her to have the manager come & talk to me if necessary. After some back & forth they offered a pitcher of beer & cocktail. Issue 4 - Finally, we had ordered 2 calamari which literally took over an hour. I also found that there was limited vegetarian options. Overall I was mainly very disappointed by the customer service & that there was no soju. This really affected the whole dinner & they could have made it up to us by being proactive & offer us a discount or some free items to apologize for the situation. Instead we had to ask & ¬´ fight ¬ª for it. They definitely do not know how to give good customer experience. Only redeeming quality is that the food was good.View more

Brewskie Brasserie in Old Montreal is an absolute gem for beer lovers! I had the pleasure of trying two standout lagers today: the "Brew Juice Gourmandise" No. 6 & the "Dark Czech Lager" No. 14. The No. 6 is simply delicious-smooth, flavorful, & surprisingly refreshing. The No. 14, a classic Czech lager, remains a solid, well-crafted choice that never disappoints. But the real star here is the "Peanut Buster" stout, hands down our favorite. Just be warned: it sells out fast, both on tap & in bottles to-go, so make sure to check if it's in stock. This place knows its craft, & the quality shines through every sip. A must-visit spot for anyone looking to explore exceptional beers in Old Montreal!View more

Second visit here, the food is still good but the service has dropped considerably. TLDR: food is good when prepared properly, service quality is poor being ignored nearly the entire time & receiving food nearly an hour after ordering while others ordered & ate despite arriving after us. Don't recommend for the service but food is good & the terrace is nice. Restaurant was at maybe half capacity when we arrived & were seated for 30mins before being asked for our order, an entree of taquitos dorados came after 15mins with 2/3 rolls full of nothing but plain mashed potatoes & the last stuffed with only chicken. Waited another 35mins for our main course of nachos & tacos, the carnitas tacos were great, gf's nachos were okay. Waitress was more occupied with visiting the table her friends were at then checking in on us, only came twice during our dinner, once to pick up the entree plate that had been empty for 15mins on the edge of the table & to ask if we wanted more drinks, then again when we had literally just received our main course not even having taken a bite to ask if everything was to taste. The tables with her friends & another with a family of 4 both arriving after we had already ordered & been waiting over 10mins, received & finished their meals before we received a thing. The waitress didn't check in to explain or apologize for the delays in the kitchen although she had the time to chit chat with her friends & other staff the vast majority of our stay. Willing to give the benefit of the doubt to the kitchen for the slow speed but the service & communication from the wait staff leaves much to desire.View more

La Banquise is the best poutine spot in all of North America. There's just nothing quite like it. There's a wide selection of different poutine's to try, but just the original classic poutine on its own is SO GOOD. It may even concert a poutine hater to a poutine lover. Now I know what you're thinking, "It's just fries with cheese & gravy on top. How good could it be?" Well it's pretty darn good because we have kept coming back time after time on our visits to Montreal & we're from Toronto. I've attached pictures & videos of our visit on two separate occasions, one year apart. Here's something you have to know: you will have to wait & it will be crowded. There are so many people that want to try this poutine & come back because it is quite literally world famous so there's always a line out front. Also, once you get inside, it is a pretty small restaurant, but there are many tables that are very closely placed together so you might feel a little bit cramped. However, the service is quick because they need to be to accommodate all the people constantly coming in & out, & they're pretty helpful at helping you choose what you might like. We recommend the classic poutine & La Royale. We also heard that a lot of locals prefer the poutine across the street at La Poule Mouill√©e but we realized they only serve one type of poutine there so we chose to try a well-known & widely popular restaurant instead, & we're glad that we did. It lives up to the hype & you have to try it the next time you're in Montreal.View more

Mixed feeling experience for a birthday party. I booked over 2 months ahead of time for 20 people. I asked if I could bring helium balloons, & they accepted. I also asked to bring a cake, which they accepted for a cutting fee of 5$ per person, to keep it in the fridge, & to use candles & sparkling candles that I would provide. I also had a few calls weeks before to clarify some points with them, & everything seemed to be good. 4h before the event started, I got a call saying that they wouldn't be able to keep the cake in the fridge, because they aren't a restaurant. I was already on my way with the cake & balloons, so we discussed with the manager. He accepted to take the cake before the event, but refused to keep it after the event while we were going out to a party after. They also refused to take the balloons I brought because it would mess with their ambiance that they want to keep chic. After discussing, they accepted to keep only the two balloons representing the birthday numbers. I then lost all of my other helium balloons. When they brought the cake, they didn't bring any of the sparkling candle that we agreed upon, just the two candles with two birthday numbers. The event was planned to be on the terrasse with a view, but because it rained that day they installed us indoor on small tables. We couldn't order individual plates per lack of space, so we had to make it a buffet, ordering a lot of the sharing options they offer. However, they didn't even have enough of what we ordered. & while being expensive, these snacks are not easily shareable, & not worth the price. The good things: -The drinks tasted good. -The one waiter tried to accommodate us as much as he could, with a nice smile. -Nice atmosphere inside. Cons: -Because of their lack of organization or clear rules, they added a lot of pressure & stress on me 4h before the event while it was booked for over 2 months. -I lost so much money & wasted my time for items that they accepted ahead of time but in the end refused to use. -They provide only 1 bill for groups, so enjoy your time to split it after (it was mentioned during the reservation). -The shareable options are good if you are only 2 or 3 on it, but expensive for the size & taste. I recommend for casual drinks in an intimate setting, but not for group or organized event.View more

I recently had the pleasure of visiting Nacarcat, & nabilbartenderI must say, it was an experience to remember. The ambiance of the place was the first thing that caught my attention-chic, modern, & welcoming, with a touch of sophistication that sets the perfect tone for an evening out. The highlight of my visit, however, was the amazing cocktail I ordered. From the moment it arrived at my table, I was impressed by the presentation. The vibrant colors & garnishes were artfully arranged, making it almost too beautiful to drink. But drink it I did, & it was nothing short of spectacular. The first sip was a revelation. The balance of flavors was impeccable-each ingredient was carefully chosen & expertly mixed to create a harmonious blend that was both refreshing & complex. The use of fresh, high-quality ingredients was evident, & the cocktail had a perfect balance of sweetness, acidity, & a hint of bitterness. It was clear that the mixologist at Nacarcat is a master of their craft. What truly set this cocktail apart was the depth of flavor. As I sipped, I discovered new notes & nuances that kept my taste buds intrigued & delighted. There was a subtle hint of citrus that brightened the drink, a touch of herbal complexity that added depth, & a smooth, lingering finish that made me savor every last drop. The staff at Nacarcat were also a significant part of the experience. They were knowledgeable, friendly, & passionate about their craft, making excellent recommendations & ensuring that every aspect of my visit was enjoyable. In conclusion, my experience at Nacarcat was nothing short of exceptional. The ambiance, the service, &, most importantly, the outstanding cocktail, made it a night to remember. I highly recommend visiting Nacarcat if you're looking for an unforgettable cocktail experience. I hope this captures the essence of your experience! If you have any specific details you'd like to include, feel free to let me know.View more

I am absolutely delighted with my experience at Rutba, Montreal. This Indian restaurant exceeded all expectations with its exceptional food & diverse menu. What impressed me the most was how they strike the perfect balance-while offering authentic Indian flavors, they also cater to a wider audience, including French & English-speaking locals. The restaurant was buzzing with people from different cultural backgrounds, which speaks volumes about the quality & versatility of their offerings. Here's what I tried & loved: ‚Ä¢ Hara Bhara Kebab: Perfectly cooked & packed with flavor. ‚Ä¢ Noodle Manchurian Platter: A unique & creative dish I've never seen before, served in generous portions. ‚Ä¢ Zafani Broccoli: Simply amazing & cooked to perfection. ‚Ä¢ Lachha Paratha: The best I've ever had, even compared to those in India-crispy, flaky, & absolutely delicious. ‚Ä¢ Dal & Paneer Piyaza: Rich, flavorful, & comforting. ‚Ä¢ Rosemary Naan & Garlic Naan: Soft, aromatic, & bursting with taste. Rutaba has truly mastered the art of blending tradition with innovation. Every dish was thoughtfully prepared, & the flavors were nothing short of extraordinary. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience. Can't wait to visit again! Thanks surbhi & shravani for making our visit to Montreal so special.View more

To be honest, my overall dining experience in Montreal was a bit disappointing. I probably had too high expectations, & that led to my letdown. I had high hopes for **Ib√©ricos**, & why wouldn't I? Venezuelans are known for offering great customer service, & no matter where you go, they always manage to make you smile or have a good time. That being said, it may not be entirely the owner's or chef's fault, but if I were to offer some advice, I'd suggest they focus on improving customer service. They could definitely work on making sure their staff provides better service. We were never greeted when we arrived, & a few of the staff members just looked at us & ignored us as if we didn't matter. It wasn't until about 10 minutes later that we had to ask where we could sit. Honestly, the service felt cold & disinterested. The food, however, was excellent - I have no complaints there. The paella was delicious, with the socarrat cooked perfectly, & the presentation was spot-on, 10/10. The Basque cheesecake was a nice way to end the meal & definitely made the experience a bit better. It was fantastic, 10/10. P.S. I'm not sure if he was a waiter or a busboy, & he didn't introduce himself, but he spoke only French & had dark skin. Thanks to him, my time at the restaurant ended on a positive note. He was a really nice guy, & I hope they take care of him.View more

I visited Poutineville Queen Mary on a quiet Wednesday evening at 4 PM. The restaurant was nearly empty, with only one other table occupied. Unfortunately, my experience left much to be desired. There appeared to be only one waitress, Natalia, who served us promptly when we arrived. However, after taking our orders, she seemed to disappear. We waited quite some time for our food, which was surprising considering we ordered a simple burger & a sandwich. Natalia's attitude was disappointing. She was dry & uninterested when we tried to engage in conversation. At one point, we found her in the back, engrossed in her phone, completely ignoring the dining area. The lack of attentive service was frustrating. We needed more ketchup for our fries (which came as a side with our burger & sandwich), but Natalia was nowhere to be found. The restaurant provides ketchup in packets, which is inconvenient & annoying. The overall quality of the food was underwhelming. Nothing stood out, & I expected more from this place. The food took quite some long time for a simple burger & grilled chicken sandwich. I won't be returning to Poutineville Queen Mary. The lackluster service, mediocre food, & Natalia's indifference left a lasting impression. There are better options in Montreal. If you decide to visit, I hope your experience is better than mine! üòäView more

I don't even know where to start - if I could give 10 stars, I would! This past weekend, I hosted my dad's surprise 70th birthday party for around 40 guests at Origine Brass, & I have nothing but the highest praise for the incredible staff who went above & beyond, making sure everything was flawless. Marc-Andr√©, the manager, was exceptional, working closely with me for weeks to plan the shared menu & coordinate the setup. His support turned my nerves into excitement, as he handled every detail with care. On the night of the event, our waiter, Justin, was absolutely outstanding. He was attentive & warm, checking in with me throughout the evening to ensure everyone had their drinks & dishes on time. The service was flawless - executed with such warmth & ease. My guests couldn't stop raving about the food & the ambiance; everyone was saying how they couldn't wait to return. Adding a personal touch, Dimo, their talented performer, welcomed my dad with a heartfelt rendition of "Happy Birthday" right as he walked in for his big surprise! My dad was beyond touched & kept saying how perfect the venue was, allowing everyone to mingle freely & enjoy a truly memorable evening. I can't recommend Origine Brass highly enough for West Island events - they're absolute professionals, & your event will be unforgettable in their capable hands. Thank you, Marc-Andr√©, Justin, the talented kitchen team, & all the staff involved in making the night a success, I wish I knew everyone's name to shout them out! Jukebox Burgers is a classic Burger shop with 60's Nostalgia which was awesome. It feels like you are travelling in time. I've been here 3 times & counting. Here is my opinion. Good: A) Location. Location is in March√© de l'Ouest with many shops & stores around. B) Service is good & decent. C) The food is delicious & the portion they give you is a lot. D) You can customize your food at some point but mostly with burgers & their sides. E) The atmosphere is just nice inside & you feel like you are back in the 60-90's. F) Accessible for all & wheel chair as it's in the first floor. G) Washroom is clean & they should maintain it & maybe renovate it to make it better. Bad: A) You can't sit where you like. They prefer they rotate so you can't choose where you sit. B) They don't fill up waters cups or don't give you a pitcher of water if they don't want to fill water. They should fix & solve that issue. C) They need to work on their French. Some were good in French but others need to be fully bilingual. Conclusion: Jukebox is a classic burger & milkshakes. Sort of like a Johnny Rockets or A classic American diner but better than that. It's better than most fast food burgers & I love the many selections & hospitality they have. For sure I will return & hope they improve on the washrooms the Water filling & the friendly atmosphere. Hope they can make this restaurant environmentally friendly & sustainable for many years to come. God Bless the people of Jukebox Burgers. God Bless the restaurant & God Bless the customers who keep coming back & making a difference to the restaurant. God Bless you all. Thank you.View more

When I first walked into this restaurant, I'll admit, I had my doubts. The d√©cor was simple, & the layout unremarkable-hardly the setting you'd expect for an unforgettable dining experience. But I couldn't have been more wrong. This is, without a doubt, the best Italian food I've ever had. The pizza was a masterpiece. The dough, with its subtle hints of yeast & olive oil, was cooked to perfection-crispy yet tender, bursting with authentic flavor. The vegetables were roasted beautifully, adding layers of complexity, & the crust? To die for. When I pulled out a slice, the cheese stretched endlessly, a visual & culinary delight. Exactly what you'd expect from a real pizza. & then there was the pasta. I've never tasted a sauce so rich & perfectly balanced. It wasn't just food-it was art on a plate. The service matched the quality of the cuisine. The server was incredibly kind & attentive, going above & beyond to ensure we were comfortable. When we needed more space, she effortlessly added the table next to ours without hesitation. She wasn't just serving; she was also helping the chef, washing dishes, & somehow still managing to make every guest feel cared for. I am amazed by the sheer power these two have for running a restaurant with several tables occupied. As we left, she even stepped outside to say goodbye from a distance-a simple but touching gesture that encapsulated the warmth of the entire experience. This restaurant may not catch your eye at first glance, but it will capture your heart with its authenticity, exceptional food, & heartfelt service. It's a place where beautiful memories are created, & for that, I am deeply grateful. Thank you for an unforgettable evening.View more

They don't like detailed reviews. Had a 4 course/MTL table meal. Service was friendly & professional. Overall meal, barely a 6/10, mostly for blandness & the temperatures dishes were served at. Would not go back. Appetizer plate delicate, 3 tiny morsels. I liked the duck (8/10) & goat cheese (7/10), but the creme brulee failed (4/10), it was sprinkled with too much sugar, which was soggy, not crystallized. I guess they failed to notice &/or forgot to'brulee'- like a wet egg omelette. The seafood bisque (6/10) was not creamy or smooth like a bisque but was rustic - nice but it was served tepid. I almost sent it back to have it heated but was too hungry. Served in a pretty little bowl, 2 mussels, 2 shrimp with the'bisque' but lacked any depth of flavor. The salmon (3/10) as the main course had zero flavour profile to speak of - plus it was undercooked & almost raw. I love sushi, so I ate it, but again, a barely warm plate. The skin was soft & grey & had a slight fishy taste - not so ok. The risotto was very pasty & salty. I told the waitress but she didn't seem to understand & did nothing about it. My son had the Deer Burger (7/10) good but dry. He had to add quite a bit of the mayo to it. Fries with it were good. The desserts are relatively big. My son made the observation that he'd prefer bigger mains & not so much sugar. The Raspberry mousse cloud (7/10) was v pretty, but too much overly sweet meringue. I like pure whipped cream but this had too much added sugar/filler. The maple dessert (7/10) was very creamy, similar to the cream on the Raspberry. The table next to us had the hazelnut which I think I'd have preferred. Would likely rate higher if had our food been served warm & if there had been more flavour than just salt.View more

Jack Saloon focuses on cuisine inspired by Nashville & the American South, with greater emphasis on Tex-Mex ingredients. For example, the beef tartare is now served with marinated onions, buffalo sauce & marrow bone for carnivorous flair, while the salmon tartare is topped with nachos. An expanded offering of shareable appetizers & vegetables now includes corn ribs, roasted broccoli with ranch sauce & dynamitas made with strips of spicy green bell pepper rolled in a pastry topped with cream cheese & cheddar, then deep-fried. My wife & I had the delight of trying two of the restaurant's top-rated & most highly recommended burgers. The first was the "The Australian Stockmen" burger, built on a soft, pillowy brioche bun. At the heart of this burger was a juicy, hearty beef patty topped with a tangy spread of goat cheese. The zesty pop of pickled beets added an unexpected bite, balanced by fresh spinach, ripe tomatoes, & sharp red onion. But the pi√®ce de r√©sistance was the blueberry mayo, lending a sweet, fruity contrast to the savory layers. The result? An explosion of unconventional flavors that melted in my mouth. It was a strange yet deeply satisfying combination, like nothing I've ever tasted before in a burger. The second burger, "The Crispy Avocado-Ranch Chicken," was equally impressive. Served on a toasted sesame seed bun, this burger featured a perfectly breaded chicken breast with a crispy, golden exterior. Cool, crisp iceberg lettuce & juicy tomatoes provided a refreshing contrast, while jalapenos delivered a fiery kick. What set this burger apart was the creamy, indulgent avocado-ranch sauce, which added a smooth, rich finish to every bite. This unique flavor combination gave the burger an air of sophistication & truly set it apart. Both meals were accompanied by a generous serving of succulent, perfectly cooked house fries, crispy on the outside & tender on the inside. Each fry was golden-brown & seasoned to perfection, achieving that delicate balance of crunch & fluffiness that can only be described as heavenly. Paired with a side of rich, spicy mayo for dipping, the fries offered an irresistible combination of heat & creaminess, elevating this classic side to a whole new level of indulgence. Jack Saloon's burgers are expertly crafted, blending premium meats, inventive toppings, & top-notch ingredients to offer an unforgettable dining experience. Whether you're a devoted burger lover or seeking something out of the ordinary, Jack Saloon delivers a mouthwatering meal that impresses you with both its bold flavors & striking presentation. To quench your thirst like a saloon frequented by the cowboys of the American West, Jack Saloon is a place where you arrive early after work to drink a beer, eat & unwind, & where the evening ends very late. In a nod to the days of the Wild West, when cowboys drank a beer after work to quench their thirst & a shot of whiskey to relax, Jack Saloon offers keg beer on special every day from 4 pm to 7 pm, & a free shot of whiskey in a nod to the Boiler Maker. -Tony Medeiros MtlRestoRapView more

I'd like to say first & foremost, I have worked in the restaurant industry for years when I was younger. I'm Greek, & we love food. La Campagnola was a restaurant I first went to in 2017. The authentic Italian food prepared in such a craftsmanship manner floored me. A bring your own wine place that had the best Italian food I've ever had. My friend who found it organized groups of 6-8 of us at a time. We would get so many appetizers & our main meals & would split it all as a group. Very affordable & incredible wait staff no matter who was working. Some senior staff some new staff... Didn't matter everyone was amazing. Years later I came back. Nothing has changed except the decor. Nicely updated. The food was as good as I can remember, saw some familiar faces. I brought someone there for the first time & I got to relive the surprise & enjoyment on someone's face who first tastes the food here. I love this place.View more

Incredible service, but the Menu offerings fell short. Per a colleagues recommendatiom, I accompanied some friends to celebrate a birthday at La Campagnola. Upon entry, I loved the atmosphere created by the mini-secluded dining areas which made the night feel more intimate & memorable. The food however, fell short of my expectations, I enjoyed the bread & butter offered as an appetizer, it was fresh & the in-house butter they had was an interesting deviation from the norm. I ordered the parmesan fries as a starter & they lacked a feeling of freshness/crispyness to them. I chose the Pepperoni Pizza as a main & it was above average but didnt really impress me much, it tasted close to what I have had at fast food restaurants, so I was a little dissapointed by this. Despite my gastronomic experience, the service provided by the staff was incredible; they were polite, patient & they made the night an enjoyable experience. I'm not sure if I would go there again, but if I did, it would be for the intimate dining experience(perfect for date nights) & to try a different menu item!View more

Exceptional Service & Delightful Indian Cuisine at Dawat I recently had the pleasure of dining at Dawat in Montreal, & I must say, the experience exceeded my expectations in every way. One of the standout aspects of our visit was the incredibly swift service. We were in a bit of a hurry, & the staff at Dawat went above & beyond to accommodate us, managing to serve our entire order within just 10 minutes. While I'm sure such rapid service may not always be the norm, it certainly left a lasting impression on us. Now, onto the food-each dish was nothing short of perfection. We started with the fish pakora, which was an absolute delight. The pakoras had the perfect amount of crunch, & the accompanying chutney was a flavor-packed complement that elevated the dish. The mutton curry was another highlight of the meal. The mutton was cooked to tender perfection, with the rich, aromatic gravy infusing every bite with deep, satisfying flavors. It's clear that a lot of care goes into the preparation of their curries, as the depth of flavor was truly remarkable. The dal makhani was just as impressive. It was creamy, well-seasoned, & had the comforting, hearty taste you'd expect from this classic dish. The palak paneer was another winner; the paneer was soft & fresh, while the spinach gravy was flavorful & well-balanced. Every dish we ordered was outstanding, showcasing the authentic flavors of Indian cuisine with precision & care. From start to finish, our experience at Dawat was top-notch, & I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a delicious Indian meal in Montreal.View more

Leaving two stars instead of one because we never got to actually try the drinks & food. I wanted to check out the place before taking an important group of 15 clients there in a month. Thank God I did that before taking them to experience this (inexistent) level of service. My girlfriend & I showed up at 6 pm on a Saturday, before a diner reservation, & the place was almost empty. Despite that, we have been greeted by a lukewarm hostess who was telling us the place was fully booked for the night. No problem, we said, as we would stay less than an hour, & leave before it would fill up. We then sat at the bar, & waited 25 minutes without anyone actually acknowledging us, despite us trying to establish eye contact with someone, anyone. With 30 minutes left until our reservation at another restaurant which thankfully saved our night, we simply left (& finally got eye contact from the server at that point, where he was basically telling us goodbye). We really did not feel welcome, despite the fact that I don't think we lacked respect & were genuinely excited to try the drinks & tapas, which looked really good. I rarely leave bad feedback like that, as I'm really easy to please, but it is a very competitive market in that area, & restaurants/bar should really learn that each client matters. I'll be taking my high spending corporate group elsewhere because of that experience which might have looked very trivial at the time.View more

We went here for our annual holiday get-together & found out if the recent influencer hype is justified. It's important to note we did not try the new "menu experience" because they lacked the items we wanted. So we picked our own. Firstly, we were greeted with, quite honestly, subpar service for a place with a menu at those prices. We realize the place is called "mauvais Gar√ßons" , but the service was fitting of that. Apparently, "May I take your order?" has gone out of style & been replaced with an uninterested & lazy, "So what are we doing? What's happening for food?". But that's subjective; maybe I'm too old-fashioned or snobby ???‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Our tabletop was also loose & kept shifting by serval inches every time we rested our elbows on it. As for the food itself, the sliders were by far the best thing we tried, & we have had better. We also don't understand how the menu says "√† partager" but each dish is an odd number (3) of items. Yet, the tables are for 2, 4, or 6 people, not triangles or nonagons. Given the elevated price for the small portions, this is a problem for us. We ordered 3-4 plates each, a drink, & a dessert, spent $120 each  (no GST/TPS that day), shared, & left hungry anyway (actually ate again elsewhere). The dessert was also tiny & subpar in taste. You may have seen some hype around the $65 7-course "menu experience". We suggest trying that if it includes all the dishes you want to try. But it's for a minimum of two people, so $65 becomes $130 to share one extra item (the plates will have 4 instead of 3 from what we saw in the reels). It's not as ridiculously cheap as advertised, but still slightly less overall, & maybe you won't leave hungry. For our experience,  unfortunately it did not live up to the hype & was not worth driving through Montreal's Saturday dinner-time traffic. We apologize for the mostly negative review, we understand that our single, isolated experience may not be the norm at this particular restaurant.View more

This is a relatively new chain in the area - they started popping up all over. Jacques Cartier pizza is located in a strip mall, it is a small restaurant ideal for take out. There are 2 tables in the restaurant & a couple outdoor seats. Although they specialize in pizza, the menu also features fast food items like burgers, hot dogs, wings, poutines, submarine sandwiches & pasta. We walked in & ordered a combo special, a medium size 14inch "Western" pizza, it comes with 2 cans of soda & a small french fry. The menu advertises this at a special price if you opt for the "All dressed" pizza. When we were discussing options, the employee working at the counter told us it's not just that type, we could pick any pizza we wanted. The way he said it, it made it seem like he would do us a favor & just let us pick any type at that price. Once he rang up the bill though, it was an extra $3 or so to get the toppings we wanted. The meal came up to around $36 or $38 which didn't seem like much of a "special". The pizza itself was very good, better than I expected. I was glad the toppings were generous & fresh. The toppings were distributed mostly in the center of the pizza though & not spread far enough on the edges. The fries were not good - these are frozen, boring, flavorless fries. Too crispy on the outside, not salted well. I wouldn't get them again. There's a pizza joint at every corner in the area, I didn't think Jacques Cartier stood out from the competition. We found this chain to be pricy compared to other local pizza places that offer 2 for 1 deals for example, or walk-out specials. I know other places that offer a large pizza with a carry-out special price of $15, whereas all the pizza options here are $25 to $35 min. I haven't received any coupons or heard about specials since they opened so unless they have a new promotion doubtful I would be back.View more

I've been living in the west island my entire life but never had the chance to visit Cosmopolitain, despite hearing great things about it. However, today, while I was in Laval, I decided to give it a try for the first time with a friend who highly recommended it. We both opted for two eggs, meats, & a sweet dish. I requested to substitute potatoes with berries, but they couldn't accommodate the request & wanted to charge an extra $5.95, so I settled for half a Romaine lettuce leaf & 2 tomatoes with a small portion of berries. To my surprise, they only had strawberries & raspberries as they were out of blueberries & blackberries. When our plates arrived, we were shocked to see that the bacon portion consisted of only two pieces, & the waitress confirmed that it was the standard serving. The overall experience was disappointing. The plates looked empty, the service lacked personality, & the staff's response to our concerns was unsatisfactory. I have no plans of returning to this place, as it's not worth it. I would recommend saving your money & visiting Allo mon Coco or any other breakfast place that offers more generous portions.View more

Heard great things about this place from friends who've lived in Greece so decided to try it. Place is situated in a strip mall & has a big terasse & ample parking. Waitress, cashier & staff were all sweet & friendly. Don't expect much for decor on the exterior as it's a non-permanent patio. They did however have good seating & greenery to make up for it. We got 3 pork gyro pitas, a greek salad & fries. Fries were excellent, crispy & properly seasoned. Greek salad had every opportunity of being amazing, & we were excited to finally see a true authentic Greek salad (cucumber, tomato, green peppers, onion, feta & olives) however, there was no green pepper in it when we received it. What a bummer :( They got extra points for putting fries in the pita, the proper way in greece, however mine just had 3-4 fries. Being the cheaper ingredient, it'd be nice if there a few more. Makes it look richer without costing much. They also lost a point for putting the tzatziki on the meat. That usually causes a mess. Best way is like they do in Greece (pita, tzatziki on pita, tomatoes & onions, then meat, then fries. Pita was good but I'd suggest they oil it a bit when warming it up on the hot plate, if not it's dry. Hope they read the comments a d improve as I'd love to try them again. Place has every potential in becoming the best gyro place in montreal. I suggest you get the gyro pita, Greek salad, & friesView more

Update location in the Old port The decor & the bar was really nice Service was good, the waitress was nice, the oysters were lovely. We got the bao bun, it was really good, the griot & the goat, we were surprised that the goat didn't come with anything & for it to be 45$, i wasn't able to eat it because of the harsh smell. Ive eaten goat before & the smell was bever this harsh, waitress didn't recommend us to get sides, the only side we had was 3 pieces of plantain with the griot It would have been nice for her to let us know maybe we wouldn't have ordered 2 meat plates Also we were the last ones there & we felt like we were getting stared at to leave by all the employees, & it made us feel uncomfortable even one of the employees asked my friend if she can move from her chair because they wanted to clean & rearrange the table while we were still there. After having to pay over 200$ each I think they could have been abit more courteous towards there clientele Cute little Carribean place. We were 2 ppl & we got the shared plate for 2 but it was alot. It was nice to have different stuff on the platter to try but definitely alot to share for 2 ppl, I wish they had told us that the portions are insanely big. The food itself was so good, the only bad part was that the crab was overcooked. They have the meat or the seafood platter that you can chose from, we chose the meat,on the platter we had okra, plantain, griot, lamb, steak, crab, octopus, arrancini, rice, salad & a few dipping sauces. We got mojitos as drinks, the drinks were average If we do go back with will probably be a bigger group to share the platter, or we would get out own plate. Plus it would cost you cheaper if you get your own plate. Firegrill St-Laurent: A Mixed Experience - 3.9/5 At first glance, Firegrill St-Laurent makes a fantastic impression. The restaurant is stunning, with a beautifully designed space that exudes warmth & sophistication. The staff is equally impressive-welcoming, attentive, & genuinely fun to interact with. They made us laugh & were incredibly helpful throughout the evening. The presentation of the food was equally appealing, & it's clear that attention to detail is a priority. However, the experience faltered when it came to execution. I ordered the Filet Mignon blue, but it arrived more cooked than I had requested, missing the mark on this delicate preparation. I also opted for a lobster tail, but unfortunately, it was served undercooked. When I sent it back, I was disappointed that the same tail was simply refired rather than replaced-a surprising choice, given the $26 price tag. To add to the frustration, it came back overcooked. That said, I don't suspect these issues are a regular occurrence. It's possible that their top chefs weren't in the kitchen on December 26th-a busy time of year where inconsistencies can sometimes happen. Everything else we ordered was well-prepared & enjoyable, & the ambiance made the evening pleasant. With some improvements in food preparation, Firegrill has the potential to be exceptional. For now, it's a good spot with some room to grow.View more

My wife & I dined at Chez Delmo twice, while on vacation. A truly exceptional experience in all ways. The lobster bisque is to die for. Had a great time with Benoit, the co-owner, who was pleasant company.View more

In Montreal for 1 night & Chez Delmo was recommended to us by our hotel concierge when we inquired about a local place to eat that had great seafood. The only reservation for 2 available was at the bar & we were ok with that. In the end I am so grateful we dined at the bar as David made our experience all that much better. He was very educated on the menu, made excellent recommendations', made sure his team paid attention to all the small details & had great conversation with us. It was fun watching him mix drinks & I admired his skill, so much so that I had to order a martini after watching him expertly make them. The lobster bisque was chalked full of succulent lobster in a lovely broth. We had beef tartare, which I generally hate but absolutely loved, & oysters to start. My husband had the catch of the day (halibut) while I dined on the creole crab. Everything was superb. We met the owners & heard some of the history of Chez Delmo. It is nice to see such pride in ownership. We definitely do not regret dining here & would make this a staple when we visit.View more

Really??? We had an issue with an item & the Owner resolved it followed up as expected - no harm no foul. But I have to say after that resolution we were treated by the waitstaff as if we had leprosy. After the table was partially cleared, we waited for someone, anyone, to check in or offer a dessert menu..finally after 20 minutes we had to go chase the server to get one. Let me say, the restaurant was less than half full, so no excuse there. The Tiramsu was good, dish cleared, & we're back to leprosy status again....waiting another 20 minutes & completely ignored again, so we chase down the waiter again for the bill. Really wanted to let the owner know how disappointed we were but he seemed to have developed a singular chatty patty focus on 2 gentlemen seated at the bar. Finally got the bill after 25 minutes..& the waiter snatched the bill from my hand. Very very disappointed in the staff. About the food, the French onion soup & lobster bisque were very good but the walleye, a flakey white lake fish, was so over salted it was nearly inedible...& that's why the food is rated a 3....The waiter was terrible, the food was just ok... Will not go back ..EVER!!!View more

If there was ever a hidden gem to be found, this is one of them. This is a local family run restaurant where you come for a home cooked Italian meal when life is too busy for a home cooked Italian meal. Their pizzas are amazing. My favourites are the pizza panzone & the linguini primavera with chicken. My kids could eat the fettuccini alfredo & tortellini gigi every day. We often order group meals for the office from here & we still can't figure out how food can be delivered so hot & so fresh. See you again soon La Villetta!View more
Very authentic Italian Food!View more

I live in a 5-minute radius from this restaurant so delivery is always fast & food always arrives hot. However the quality has never been exceptionally good & has gone down even further. Tonight was likely my last time ordering from La Villetta, which is a shame as it's a family-owned business I'd like to support & its proximity to me is very convenient. The pasta is always very overcooked - I mention how close I live to this restaurant because I'll be generous & factor in that the pasta continues cooking while it's hot, but this is beyond what's reasonable for a place 5 minutes away from me. Very bland food generally. I used to really like the chicken parmigiana submarine sandwich, as it's a very generous portion for the price. It used to be nice! Not the best, but great for a supper with half leftover for another meal easily. Tonight the chicken tasted strange & left a bad aftertaste in my mouth. They used to make a very nice bruschetta but tonight I was served soggy bruschetta bread that was already soaked with tomato juice. I can't help but to wonder if they served me someone's leftovers? If not, then they clearly forgot that it was a delivery order after assembling the bruschetta, & were too lazy or too cheap to re-toast 2 rolls. This was reported to Uber Eats with photo. This club has it's pros & cons. Cover & coatcheck fees are reasonable, but the bar prices are up there. For the high prices, the service level is not there. The bartender I was ordering from was giving me bad energy the whole time. Twice after ordering my drink, she would go to a customer who was flirting with her & chat with him a few minutes before I could pay for my drink, making me unnecessarily wait to rejoin my friends. This place markets itself as an 80's-90's themed club but at least 1/3 of the music I heard was post 90's. It wasn't a huge deal to me personally, but if you are coming specifically for the music they claim to play, you might be disappointed. Best feature of this place is the lighting & the overall design. The Lite-Brite dancefloor is really fun. It's a great space to dance. Tables are at the side & not in the way like some other clubs. All they really need is better bartenders with professional service & this would be a 5-star club.View more

I don't visit as often as I I'd like, given my frequent travels abroad, but every meal I've had here, as well as those of my dining companions, has been stellar. I had the opportunity to revisit during the holiday season, when a Christmas table d'h√¥te menu was in effect. Happily, it included most of my favorite dishes, so it wasn't at all a hardship. Lina, one of the two wonderful hostesses, greeted us warmly as we arrived & we were sat at a window table. The dining room was intimate & the atmosphere, convivial, as is usually the case. We were three, & we all found items on the menu to satisfy our hunger. We were starving, & Lina happily accommodated our all too frequent requests for additional bread in between the courses. Who doesn't like warm bread on a cold winter evening? We started off with the amuse-bouche of cromesquis of foie gras, basically a stuffed croquet. It was delicious, accompanied by a sweet relish of sorts. We then had the tomato soup as our first entr√©. It was pure velvet, with a delicately balanced flavour, slightly sweet, slightly acidic & served perfectly hot to ward off the winter chill. For our second entr√©, my companions chose the scallop carpaccio, which they both loved. I went for the escargot vol au vent, which was my only disappointment for the evening. I found the pastry absorbed too much of the garlic butter, leaving the escargots somewhat dry. No matter, not a big deal. For our mains, two of us selected the souris d'agneau, no mice involved, only lamb shanks. ??? The meat was fall off the bone succulent. It basically melted in our mouths. Melanie, our lovely second hostess, told us it took 15 hours to achieve this degree of tenderness. I've had it three times already, & it's one of my favourite dishes here. Our other dining companion chose the bavette, a beef flank steak, which he loved. We had brought our own wines, one a prosecco & the other a California zinfandel, both were perfect with our selections & nicely decanted with suitable stemware & an ice bucket by Melanie. Chilled water was provided throughout the meal. Finally, for dessert I chose the classic cr√®me brul√©e while my companions chose the boule de neige filled with chocolate mousse. All were delicious & a perfect ending to a wonderful meal. We are blessed to have such wonderful dining venues available to us here in Montr√©al. I'm anxious to return when the regular menu makes its reappearance. I'm sure I'll be as spoiled as I was during this service.View more

Based off of recommendations online, we were excited to give Mama C a try. First off, the general vibe & decor was stunning. We were so excited to be seated, but the hostess seemed annoyed & generally unpleasant. Our server was nice but seemed like he was in a rush & didn't take the time to explain anything on the menu or any specials. When we asked about the difference between two types of fish (catch of the day, which were not on the menu) all he could say was "one is bigger". We noticed that the pricing for the food was really high, but decided to give it a chance. Cheapest pasta is $42 & salads are $30+. That's fine but it took a while for us to simply order & receive our drinks & food. Our conversation kept getting interrupted by hostesses that were yelling, running around & joking with the servers (who seemed visibly annoyed). Then we noticed the hostesses sat down at the bar to eat while periodically getting up to greet guests. While they were eating, we kept waiting. The food was good but it was not worth the price, especially for abysmal service. The side of lemon potatoes was so sour it ended up being inedible. The main dishes are very plain & don't come with any sides. We ordered a shareable steak for $138 & it was good but very plain - nothing special. This place is a hard pass, especially when there are dozens of incredible restaurants in Montr√©al.View more

Went here as a small group for our restaurant of the month club & overall give it a 3/5. They called me THREE minutes before our reservation to ask if we could come AN HOUR later. Obviously people were almost there, they finally offered 7:30 instead. There was nowhere to wait other than outside in the cold. The table was ready a few minutes before that & unfortunately we were seated right next to the door so the cold air came in every time someone opened the door & twice we went to fix the mat in the entrance that would block the door & leave it open causing cold air to be blowing in. Only digital menus, but the menu is not optimized for mobile use so it was kind of a pain. Wine was well priced, cocktails were tasty, our waiter did not seem to know that you should allow the person to taste the wine before serving it to everyone. The ceviche was especially interesting with large chunks of fish, the ribeye was served in a container with lit charcoal & the flavour was unique & delicious. The chicken was moist, the shrimp dish was delicious & overall we enjoyed the food, portions were quite large. The service was just ok, they need more staff I think. Water glasses were left empty for awhile, we received our desserts & had to wait at least 10 minutes for the birthday song, as we were celebrating a birthday, so we could eat them. Not sure if I would return, but it was worth going to to try.View more

We had an amazing dining experience at Matsuno Sushi Fusion! This all-you-can-eat restaurant offers a fantastic variety of sushi & other dishes, all made with fresh & high-quality ingredients. Came here for a Christmas party from my work. 19 December, 2024. Pros: 1) Sushi & most of the food is good. 2) The Interior has a nice vibe & atmosphere. 3) The washrooms are clean & they maintain it good. 4) Most of employees are bilingual but they need to improve their English & French. 5) The service is decent at times but they need to improve on that. Cons: 1) They charge 15% if you are more than 6 people & you must pay them 15%. 2) Parking is quite difficult to find especially on busy times & days. 3) Some sushi & some things were a little salty & some sushi were breaking apart when you pick it up. 4) Service can be a little slow especially on busy night. 5) iPad keeps going back to the main page & you need an employee to reset the code. Conclusion: Matsuno is okay. I maybe don't want to comeback here because I want to try other sushi places & I know that there are better ones than this place. It's okay & maybe better for you the viewer. God Bless you & God Bless the people that keep this restaurant going but I'm indifferent on this restaurant. 2.5/5 stars for me.View more

As of Saturday December 7th 2024: Mon-Thurs Dinner $37.99+tax Fri-Sun Dinner $40.99+tax I would say arguably top 3 all you can eat sushi in all of Quebec. The food comes out fast, servers are efficient & there is a large selection. Appetizers: They have a variety of appetizers that come out fast. They are decent but I prefer to focus on the sushi. Sushi: All the sashimi selections are really fresh. The pro move is to go all in on the sashimi. The nigiri has the same quality of fish & they don't abuse the rice. They have a variety of habdrolls & maki. Like the nigiri, I am glad they don't abuse the amount of rice & each piece is small & comes in 4's so you get to try different rolls. The only downside to the maki rolls is some rolls they add way too much sauces. It makes the presentation look nice but overwhelms your taste buds. Dessert: They have sesame balls & this hot sweet bread with condensed milk to go along multiple ice cream flavors. Get there early because usually there is a wait list. You have to sign up at a tablet & they will text you when you're table is ready.View more

Was there on Saturday night for a birthday dinner. It was a first for the two of us & we are excited to go back. The place (an old house style restaurant with two levels, two sections on the ground floor & a terrace for the warmer months) wasn't too packed when we arrived for our 6pm reservation, but people really started coming in at 6:30-7pm. The food was phenomenal (they have a set menu as well as an "ardoises"/rotating menu). They offer a huge variety of food... definitely not a standard pub food place (french onion soup, octopus, fries & mussels, poke bowls, duck sausages, tartare...). We had the ribs with risotto (on the set menu) & the butternut gnocchi with porto sauce, truffle oil & braised beef cheek... I'm still thinking about the latter. If you are a foodie & love to try new beers in a cozy atmosphere, THIS is the place to go (20 minutes from the island of Montreal~WORTH IT).View more

Ate here alone lately, maybe a week or two ago. It wasn't my first time eating here but it had been a while so I decided to try it again. A Unique Concept, But Not for Everyone O'Noir offers a great dining experience, but it may not suit everyone. Unfortunately, the experience didn't work out for me as I started feeling quite nauseous & dizzy in the complete darkness. Without visual cues to gauge distance or body position, my vertigo seemed to kick in. & even though I don't have claustrophobia, I began to feel a bit panicked & short of breath in the dark. The restaurant itself was quite warm, which didn't help my discomfort. While the food was good, I found it hard to enjoy while feeling unwell. One improvement would be for the restaurant to enforce its "no loud conversation" rule & perhaps lower or turn off the music. Our room was extremely loud; a nearby table was swearing, shouting, & even making fake vomiting sounds, which added to the stress. When I started feeling really sick & needed to leave, it also took a while for the waiter to return. One additional thing to note: the waitstaff touch shoulders & hair frequently when serving drinks, which felt a bit intrusive. A more comfortable approach might be to place the glass on the table & guide guests to it without contact. Overall, I'm glad I tried it, but I definitely won't return. This experience may be best for those who aren't as sensitive to sensory overload.View more

This is a true blind eating experience. There is no light at all. You have to lock up any light emitting electronics in a locker with your coat & purse. You can choose your meal & drinks from the menu or you can select surprise food & drinks that do not appear on the menu. We decided to do the surprise options & the meals were fabulous. Everything was very flavorful & the portion sizes were perfect. My oldest son got the 3 courses so he got a surprise starter he thought was lamb on arugula but was actually shrimp on mescaline. His main course turned out to be roast beef not chicken. The boys' dessert was passion fruit & sponge cake not strawberry shortcake like they thought. My youngest son & I ended up with duck with a blueberry sauce which he guessed correctly & I had creme brule for dessert. The service was excellent & our table was mapped out exactly as our server described. It wasn't cheap-$300.00 with drinks, taxes & tip but it was an excellent experience. My youngest son had his misgivings about eating food he couldn't see but he really enjoyed it. It was nice to have a meal where the boys weren't staring at their phones but instead actually talking to me. Perhaps that alone was worth the price.View more

Disability access was questionable at best. I am confident that the door guys had the very best intentions in mind, but communication the risks is great- navigating them is up to me. I have a service dog & frequent night clubs/bars. Canada isn't as well versed with service animals, so we do experience more issues here, although the legal access is supposed to be pretty much the same. Most bars have a "rowdy crowd", "broken glass risks", loud music etc. I had the door guy challenging me saying it's a floor is lava situation (do they knowingly leave glass lying around everywhere? I'm happy to get his boots) & that he has a service dog himself, so I shouldn't be so stupid since they had a situation before where they denied access, the guy got angry, & they called the cops & pepper sprayed him. I opted to go elsewhere. I do genuinely see that they had a good intention, but a "private" business cannot deny access to members of public where they would generally admit a person without a service dog. Your morals & risks are appreciated communication, but you don't have a legal right to assume we cannot navigate & have the correct gear & training to do so.View more

My wife & I recently enjoyed an incredible dinner at Le 409, an elegant Indian restaurant in Montreal. We had a dinner reservation & were excited to explore their menu, which did not disappoint. The ambiance at Le 409 is sophisticated yet warm, blending modern d√©cor with traditional Indian accents. The dim lighting & vibrant colors created a cozy atmosphere, perfect for an intimate dinner. The service was equally impressive, with our server Benjamin providing excellent recommendations & ensuring our dining experience was seamless. For starters to share, we ordered the CHANA SAMOSA-a pastry stuffed with potatoes & spices, topped with chickpea masala. It was so delicious that we immediately ordered another round! The flavors were bold & perfectly balanced, a fantastic way to begin our meal. For our entr√©e, we opted for family-style sharing & indulged in several flavorful dishes: - BUTTER CHICKEN: Tender marinated chicken cubes in a creamy tomato sauce infused with aromatic spices. - LAMB KORMA: Lamb cubes in a creamy almond & raisin sauce, rich & mildly sweet. - LAMB ROGANJOSH: Lamb cubes cooked in a flavorful curry sauce with yogurt, mint, & spices. - CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA: Chicken cubes in a creamy sauce with onions, tomatoes, & peppers. To complement these dishes, we ordered two servings each of GARLIC NAAN & PILAU RICE, which were the perfect accompaniments to soak up the rich sauces. For drinks, we all had Mango Lassi. It was phenomenal - unlike the overly sweet versions we've had in the U.S., this one was perfectly balanced, allowing the natural flavors of mango & yogurt to shine through. Le 409 exceeded our expectations with its exceptional food, inviting ambiance, & top-notch service. This dinner was a true culinary journey, & we can't wait to return!View more

My favourite bakery tragically closed down so I'm on the hunt for a new birthday cake source. I've been keen on trying Rustique for a while now, so I was pretty excited. I ordered a number of things for delivery for my partner's birthday. Delivery was right on time. The cakes are beautiful, visually speaking. But they're lacking in both flavour & texture, & I'd rather a tasty cake than a beautiful one. The carrot cake is moist, but it seems like a base recipe for'cake' was used, & carrots were added. That is to say, it seems to be lacking a certain something that really makes it carrot cake & not just cake with carrots. Some depth of flavour that I've found in some of my favourite carrot cakes in the city. This was a disappointment, as carrot cake is my favourite! It's a good cake, but not a good carrot cake. The icing is also very bland. The chocolate ganache cake was surprisingly not good. I tried this one second, & figured that it should work better with a more basic cake recipe, but it ended up being very dry. The icing is quite hard, & while I really loved the look of the crumble on top, I found that it tasted stale. Unfortunately my partner felt the same, & neither of us wanted to eat the cake. I suppose I wish they'd push the envelope a bit more, maybe with the employment of brown butter, or cocoa butter, or almond flour... something to round it out a bit. Maybe a more basic cake appeals to a wider range of palates? But I found the taste of sugar & nothing else a let down. As an aside, my order was also incorrect. I paid for extras that I did not receive, & in general I'm pretty unhappy. $120 with delivery, & neither of the cakes are any different from something from a grocery store. Unfortunately I don't believe I'll be returning, but if I did, I think I would try one of the pies instead. üëçüèªView more

Excellent service from the moment I walked in, but unfortunately, the food did not impress me at all. I visited this restaurant because I heard the experience would cost a thousand dollars in the States. Since I went for lunch, it wasn't a course menu. All mains included one appetizer & coffee, priced at $49-53 CAD, which is a very good deal for fine dining menu. They have quite a good wine collection, & many table customers opened bottles. They also offer half glasses of wine, priced at around $10 CAD each. For my meal, I had foie gras as an appetizer & duck leg as the main course. Both dishes were heavy, overly sweet, & salty. While the duck skin was crispy, the meat was dry, & I couldn't understand the purpose of the bread placed between the mushrooms & sauce. My server, Phill, was efficient & well-organized. He handled customer questions about the wine selection quickly & knowledgeably. The post-meal coffee, however, was machine-made, a bit watery, & took over ten minutes to make. In summary, the service & ambiance were excellent, but the food was underwhelming.View more

Before I start this review, I want to acknowledge something: it takes a lot of work to run a restaurant. I wouldn't know this personally, as I am just someone who loves food experiences, but I respect the effort. Food is an art form that, at its highest moments, tells a story. The best restaurants weave this story seamlessly, from the moment you are greeted by the ma√Ætre d' to the time you sign the check. The food should justify its place on the plate, the art should be meaningful, & the ambiance should tie it all together, saying, "Thank you for choosing us. Here's why it matters." Unfortunately, Toque's story was incoherent, like the ramblings of someone lost in a drunken stupor, clinging to a reality that exists only in their head. Upon entering, the d√©cor felt like a relic of the early 2000s-a carpeted (why carpet?) time capsule. It reminded me of someone who over-prepped for Y2K, only to be left with stacks of toilet paper in their closet. My spouse & I were there to celebrate a special occasion. Having dined at similar establishments in New York, we were excited to see what Toque would deliver as a supposed bastion of fine cuisine. THE BREAD The bread was one of the only highlights-a mix of sourdough with a chewy crust & impossibly soft interior, paired with butter that could have sparked wars in earlier centuries. 9/10. THE TRAGEDY The rest of the meal spiraled into chaos, beginning with an amuse-bouche. The server offered a "surprise" or foie gras, & we opted for the surprise, only to receive lobster in a buckwheat shell-despite my well-communicated shellfish allergy. After a brief "oh...sorry," they replaced it with hastily thrown-together tuna salad. No apology beyond that, not even a simple glass of champagne to acknowledge the mistake. Here's the breakdown of the courses: 1. First Course: Trout ceviche in cold miso soup. A confusing pairing that felt random rather than intentional. (4/10) 2. Second Course: Trout (again), with beurre blanc, walnuts, & trout roe. Not terrible, but shockingly underseasoned-I had to request salt. (5/10) 3. Third Course: Walleye from Lake Erie with black garlic sauce, confit pear, & pickled radishes. Fish was fine, pear was great, sauce needed salt. (5/10) 4. Fourth Course: Young rooster with vegetables. Chicken on a tasting menu needs to be magical, but this was bland beyond forgiveness. (3/10) 5. Fifth Course: Sirloin the size of my index finger (& I'm not a large person), served lukewarm with yet another forgettable sauce. (2/10) 6. Sixth Course: The pre-dessert "surprise" was purple ube ice cream, poppyseed cake, & chocolate in a pool of Minute Maid lemonade. It was shocking, in the worst way. The cheese dish-a brie with spelt cracker-was utterly forgettable. (1/10) THE DESSERT FROM HEAVEN The seventh & final course was miraculous: a white chocolate mousse with soaked pear, chocolate bark, & citron sorbet. It was thoughtful, balanced, & decadent, erasing-almost-the disaster of previous courses. If the rest of the meal had been even a fraction as inspired as this dessert, Toque might have redeemed itself. But one great dish cannot carry a meal that failed at nearly every other step. WHAT MORE? The service lacked the attentiveness expected at this level. The manager's "gift" for our celebration-a stock card signed by the chef-felt hollow. No creative dessert, no thoughtful keepsake menu, just an afterthought. The inconsistent music-alternating between too loud & imperceptibly soft-only added to the disjointed experience. & so, we left wondering what story Toque was trying to tell. In the end, we had to make up one ourselves: Toque is an establishment so convinced of its greatness, it doesn't feel the need to explain why its food matters. Instead, it says, "We thought of this yesterday-eat it & go." Overall Rating: 2/10.‚Ä®The bread & dessert were phenomenal, but I would have been happier at a bakery with a pint of H√§agen-Dazs. After all, man cannot live on bread alone.View more

For a truly unique & unforgettable dining experience in Montreal, look no further than L'Auberge Saint-Gabriel. Located in Old Montreal, this storied establishment exudes character & charm, blending centuries-old Quebec history with modern elegance & outstanding gastronomy. We visited to celebrate a birthday & could not have chosen a better spot. The ambiance immediately draws you in with its rustic stone walls, cozy yet grand spaces, & thoughtful design touches that honor Quebec's rich heritage. The decor is captivating & perfectly complements the storied past of the building, while also providing a modern & comfortable space for guests. The service was impeccable from start to finish. The staff's attention to detail, professionalism, & warmth made us feel valued & well cared for without any pretense. They navigated the entire dining experience with ease & grace, making sure we enjoyed every moment. The highlight, of course, was the food. Each dish was crafted with precision & artistry, delivering a flawless balance of flavors that exceeded all expectations. The culinary team at L'Auberge Saint-Gabriel has truly raised the bar, creating a menu that celebrates Quebec's culinary roots while adding fresh, contemporary touches. Every bite felt carefully considered & was a delight for the senses. While the price point is on the higher side for Montreal, it is more than justified by the exceptional quality, service, & unique atmosphere. For anyone seeking a memorable experience, whether for a special occasion or simply to enjoy one of Montreal's finest dining destinations, L'Auberge Saint-Gabriel is well worth it.View more

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è A Culinary Gem with Rich History! L'Auberge Saint-Gabriel is a true treasure nestled in the heart of Montreal, & my recent visit left me absolutely enchanted! Dating back to the 1600s, the rich history of this restaurant is palpable the moment you step inside. The ambience is simply unmatched-charming, warm, & steeped in character, it provides the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable dining experience. The service was phenomenal; the staff were attentive & knowledgeable, making us feel right at home. Now, let's talk about the food! The appetizers were nothing short of incredible-each dish a delightful explosion of flavor that set the stage for the main course. I highly recommend trying their signature offerings; you won't be disappointed! The cocktail menu is a true work of art! Each drink was crafted with precision, showcasing unique flavors that perfectly complemented our meal. To top it all off, we indulged in a fine bottle of wine selected by their amazing sommelier, who guided us to the perfect choice to elevate our dining experience. Overall, L'Auberge Saint-Gabriel is a must-visit for anyone seeking a remarkable meal in a stunning historical setting. I can't wait to return for another enchanting evening!View more

Food: the food here is amazing. This is the single best Russian/eastern European that I've ever been too. The food was amazing & the recommendations were all spot on. I usually eat meat medium, they encouraged me that the best way for my meal to be eaten (the medallions i belive) was rare & oh boy it did not disappoint, it was one of the best meals I've eaten. I am also a huge hater of zucchini & was not going to eat it when it came with my meal, I ended up trying it & it was cooked to perfection. I split the tasting menu (witc was for two people, costed $110, gave 4 appetizers a main meal each, dessert & a drink)& everything on it was made with love & delicious. Service: The people that work at the restaurant are the nicest workers I've seen. It's clear they care about each consumer & value a nice, peaceful environment. They gave helpful truthful suggestions about what to order, made jokes with my party of four throughout the dinner, & when leaving encouraged us to take a lot of tiny candies on the way out. The service from beginning to end was amazing. Atmosphere: The atmosphere is very homey & peaceful. Though the restaurant is small, I've never had any trouble with getting a table for four. If anything, the restaurant allows for a nice personal vibe. The lighting dimmed with the light outside, it was made up of warm candle & overhead lighting. The decorations in the restaurant & wallpaper also furthered the homey feeling, it felt like going to a grandparents house. :]View more

I used to be a regular here at Shifu for more than a year, I've seen the change take a turn for the worse. It started when their online ordering platform stopped working with no signs of it being fixed. Previously they gave above average portion sizes for the price. Within the last six months or so, they've reduced their packaging & also introduced daily specials, but thankfully the portion size didn't change. Last week they decide to add additional sides to your typical order, & when I saw this I immediately was suspicious of them reducing the portion size. It didn't happen at that time, but after today's serving, the container shrunk in half & the portion size was significantly reduced with no sign of the daily specials on their menu. They have lost a regular customer for now, I'll check in to see if they correct this, but I'm not holding out. Time to find a new place to eat.View more

We lucked into Ol√© Tapas in Sainte-Anne-de-Bellevue for a Sunday lunch, & what an amazing find! From the moment we walked in, we were warmly greeted by Owner Chef Nikolaos, & Elizabeth, our waitress, provided fantastic service-friendly, attentive, & genuine. It's clear Nikolaos fosters a great vibe with his staff. The food was incredible. We shared the Paella de Marisco, which was as authentic as it gets. Generous portions, first-rate ingredients, perfectly cooked bomba rice, & none of that overcooked seafood you might find elsewhere. Just excellent. The Calamares a la Andaluza were perfectly fried, light, & not greasy-so much better than what you usually get in the area. & don't miss the croquette platter-a delicious mix that we'd highly recommend. To top it all off, Nikolaos treated us to some gluten-free desserts: a carrot cake-style treat & a chocolate-dark berry creation. Both were absolutely delicious & didn't feel like "gluten-free" compromises at all. Everything was devoured. Ol√© Tapas stands out in Sainte-Anne-de-Bellevue, & we'll absolutely be back. If you haven't tried it yet, you're missing out on a real gem. Highly recommend checking out their website to get inspired & then heading over for an unforgettable meal!View more

Made a reservation for 2 on a Friday night (July 5) at 6:30 pm to celebrate our anniversary with romantic atmosphere. We walked in to a boisterous group party of about 30 people. The waiter showed us to our table about 20 feet away & apologized in advance for the noise. We ordered a bottle of Ruffino Prosecco Ros√©. It was chilled & perfect. But, with the wait staff disappearing for prolonged periods of time throughout the night, our glasses were always empty & so I ended up pouring & serving ourselves the Prosecco in our glasses all night. That's not right. Complementary bruschetta was nice touch & tasty. Commentary ciabatta bread. Good. Ordered one meatball to share. It was tepid in temperature but meatball & sauce itself were tasty. Ordered a caeser salad. Portion was good & dressing was tasty but a bit heavy on the dressing. Ordered rapini & sausage. It was okay. Main meals: (1) meat tortellini ros√© which was an ok portion & pretty good. As opposed to the meatball, it came out piping hot. (2) veal Dijonnaise with side of 4 baby potatoes, a stem of broccoli & one roasted red pepper. Heavy on the sauce but overall dish was pretty good. Then wait staff came to a grinding halt & no one came back for about 20 minutes. When they finally did come to clear the dishes, they offered dessert menus. We ordered limoncello cake & tiramisu & espresso. The desserts were both excellent. Again waited a good 25 minutes for anyone to come back to tend to our table. We asked for the bill & it was finally brought. They also brought two slices of watermelon which we a nice touch. But Honest question & curious about this next point: we remember coming in past & being offered a grappa or limoncello digestive. The three tables before us who were brought bills & settling up the bill were brought digestives. Makes us wonder if the couples ordered them, or if it was an oversight on the part of our waitress or if our $190 bill didn't meet the mark of $200 to be offered this? It used to be a nice touch. Whole experience took 2.5 hours mainly due to absent or slow service. Suggestion to partition restaurant when there is a group party from other patrons. Overall disappointed with our experience.View more

Brasserie 701 was my restaurant of choice for my Christmas morning brunch! It did not disappoint!
