I was seated around 950 & everyone was floundering about setting up the buffet. It seemed like nobody was in charge & everybody was unsure of their role. I didn't even get water or a Bonjour until about 1020! But it was smooth sailing from then on out! There was a hot table with beef bourginon, eggs Benedict & salmon. The cold table featured different salads- classic Caesar, beet salad & quinoa salad. The dessert table was far off on the side & I'm not sure many people even saw it (I was sitting across from it). The sunshine hits in the most lovely way through the windows of Brasserie 701. It's perfect for taking photos! The building is beautiful from the outside as well! McKibbin's is an institution here in Montreal. I have been coming here for 20 years & have so many fond memories of nights out here. The atmosphere is lively & they often have live music. I generally find the quality of the food to be consistent. They have your standard pub fare & for the most part it is usually satisfying. If you are courageous you can always try their famous Reaper wing challenge but be warned those are some very spicy wings. McKibbin's is a great option if you are looking for a pub in downtown Montreal. You're bound to have a great time while you're there.View more

I had the pleasure of dining at Kyo Bar Japonais last night, & I must say, it was an unforgettable experience! The service was top-notch, with friendly & attentive staff who were happy to answer all our questions about the menu & make recommendations. & speaking of the menu, the selection of sushi & Japanese dishes was impressive, with something for every taste & preference. What really impressed us, however, was the quality & presentation of the dishes. Each plate was carefully crafted to be both visually appealing & delicious, with garnishes & sauces added with flair. We were invited to celebrate a friend's birthday at this place - neither my wife nor I had ever been at one of these restaurants, & I have to say, that while it was far noisier & crowded than I would have liked, the service & the food was excellent. We were a table of 12 or more & everyone ordered something either slightly different or completely so. Our waiter was polite & high-spirited & he made the experience worthwhile. I had a Caesar Salad & a fancy pizza, while others had Ossu Bucco or other equally interesting dishes that required a good cook. They didn't disappoint! I took some of the pizza home, but everything was wonderful, everyone enjoyed themselves, & given that it is a BYOWine type of establishment, the orders didn't break the bank, despite that they were slightly higher priced than I am used to. I am amazed by the amount of food they have in their menu. There is such a wide selection of meals which makes it a bit hard for me when there are so many options but it also makes it easier for larger groups to each find something they like. The portions were pretty big, especially the appetisers. They were around 20$ each plate but the portions were big enough to share for 4 which was great. The main plates are also around 20$ which is fine for their portion. The food itself was good. There was a great crunchiness to the nachos & the flavours were also pretty good. I especially like how the sauces are put on the side instead of it being poured on top of the food like so many other restaurants. The tacos were also really good. Each bite had a good amount of cheese & meat & since it came with a salad, it made the meal pretty balanced for me. The service was amicable throughout the night which also made the night more enjoyable. Unfortunately for us, we were once again sitting right beside the speakers for the live music. We took our staff here for our Christmas party. Never been, & went only on recommandations & reviews. I can say that everything I had heard was true. Food was EXCELLENT & plentiful (we had the "all you can eat"). Service was quick & efficient. They just brought the food to the table, & we never missed out on anything. Everything was perfect. The only thing that left me a little bewildered was when it was time to pay. I asked for the bill...& I paid it in cash, with a generous tip (25%), as I said, I was very happy with everything. Well, I folded the bill & the money & discreetly handed it to the waitress, telling her it was complete, & we were very pleased. This is when the waitress decided to count the money right there, on the table, right in front of my staff! I was shocked as my staff watched the whole thing..... so much for privacy. So, if the owner is reading this... you may want to speak to your staff about discretion. Would've given you 5‚òÜ if it wasn't for this hiccup.... won't keep me from coming back, though! This is a staple on the Main for decades. This place has been producing some of the best ribs, rotisserie chicken, sausage, roasted potatoes as well as sides such as their amazing Cole slaws & salads. This is a restaurant that's not about eating in with table service & such. It's mostly about take out & having a quick bite at the stool counter while people line up to order food. The displays show enticing yummy food while you wait to be served & by the time it's your time to order, you now want a little of everything! I have had everything here, but I have to say that one absolute MUST is their Nata pastry. These are made fresh & usually still warm in their display leaving the pastry crust light & flaky & the filling (an egg custard like filling) smooth & creamy. I doubt you can only eat one - I certainly can't. So to the food. Ribs: large & meaty pork ribs are perfectly cooked & seasoned. Chicken: rotisserie is fantastic juicy & skin nicely crisp. Their chicken sandwich is near perfection for a simple light fluffy fresh bun filled with fresh chicken, allowing the chicken to be the star of the meal & it was fantastic. Roasted potatoes: perfectly seasoned & cooked perfectly such that they are creamy inside & slightly crisp on the outside. Sausage: not overtly hot nor spicy, however as you begin to swallow you can feel a low warm heat develop & it's just right. They are cooked well such that the casing is nice & snappy crisp. It's a very densely packed sausage & very firm. Roasted lamb & pork: scrumptious.View more
Natas are to die for! & that chicken sandwich is also excellent. You have to try this place, it's worth it!View more

My experience at Sterling Steakhouse was a bit of a mixed bag. The ribs were tasty-tender, falling off the bone, & full of flavor. You can tell they put effort into preparing them, & they were definitely enjoyable. One thing to note is the portion size. The ribs were much smaller than what I'm used to at other places serving baby back ribs, so if you're really hungry, it might not fully hit the spot. Service was on the slow side, but the waiter was friendly & attentive that it made up for the wait. While waiting, the hot bread they serve is a nice touch-fresh, warm, & a great way to keep you going until the main course arrives. The atmosphere was nice & cozy, with that classic steakhouse vibe. If you're looking for a relaxed meal with flavorful, well-prepared ribs, don't mind smaller portions, & enjoy a slower pace, it's worth a visit.View more

What a great little restaurant!! We dined here during our stay over the New Year because the weather was not good enough to take a stroll to the many other restaurants close by, & I'm so glad that we did. We thoroughly enjoyed the following: 1. All-Dressed Nachos - was just about ok 2. Cheese Pizza - the second most liked dish for our group. It reminded me a lot of the General Assembly Pizza in downtown Toronto 3. Red Beet Tempura Fish & Chips - the batter on the fish was a bit on the oily side but the chips were crispy & delightful 4. Primavera Pasta - an absolute classic, we enjoyed this the most. Just goes to show that you don't need to add too many fancy ingredients or any other gimmicks - just let the quality of the vegetables & the olive oil speak The food was brought promptly (within 15-18 mins) & served with a smile. It was fresh & really tasty. The Pasta & Pizza were the absolute standouts of the meal. The attentiveness to follow-up with us to check on the food as well as to keep our water glasses filled was much appreciated. We definitely will give this wonderful restaurant another visit the next time that we are in MTL.View more

This gem is located on St-Laurent near the 40 highway. Although the place was quite empty, it was not because of the quality of the restaurant, or its location. It's just thanks to the constant efforts of the municipality of Montreal to transform its city in a gigantic construction yard & scare away both tourists & businesses. Put this aside, & you will discover delicious dishes prepared with care. I went to Peru once where I was amazed by the diversity & quality of local cuisine, only rivaled by the French cuisine in my opinion. At Lima 14 yesterday, I could find again the real flavors this country has to offer. The staff is great & they are always happy to guide you make your choice & explain their dishes. I chose the Anticuchos that were cooked to perfection & the delicious Causa de Pulpo while my better half chose the Fetuccini Huancainero con Lomo & a Causa Acevichada, which delicioulsy combine the richness of a causa with the freshness of the Ceviche. We will definitely come again soon to try other dishes as the menu was recently updated. Thank you, we had a great time!View more

Discovered a gem on Fleury Street during the MTL√†Table event. Booked a table for brunch to get a feel for the restaurant prior making a dinner reservation. The decor was both charming & inviting, instantly reminding me of a caf√© in Paris. The place was fully packed as I stepped into the restaurant, I came face to face with a waitress who was busily running food, carrying plates in both hands & she managed to nod & smile at me, adding a personal touch to the welcoming atmosphere. They welcomed us, showed us to our table, & carefully noted my requests during the reservation. Later in the evening, they returned to check in & ensure we were enjoying our experience. Egan (the mixologist) is exceptionally talented at their craft. I started with a Mai Tai & ended with a Daiquiri-both were absolutely sensational! When my partner couldn't decide on a drink, Egan crafted something special from scratch to suit her palate, & she couldn't have been happier. Valerie (the expo/server) was not only friendly but also extremely professional. Despite it being a busy Friday night, they took the time to describe each dish & explain how to enjoy it to fully appreciate the flavors. To top it all off, they went out of their way to entertain me by demonstrating how they fold their napkins, which I found fascinating. Thank you all for such a wonderful experience-we will definitely be back!View more

It was my first time visiting the restaurant in Montreal & it didn't quite meet expectations. The meal started strong with the fried shrimp & chicken skewers which were both delicious. For entrees I had the chicken pad see ew which was quite disappointing since they used normal rice noodle as opposed to wide thai noodle, some of the vegetables were undercooked, & they used a lot of soya sauce. I also had the braised beef panaeng...the curry sauce was delicious but the brisket was very dry & overcooked. Don't think I will return to the restaurant next time, considering there are many other authentic thai restaurants for half the price. But, if you're looking for a quick dinner/drink with great service & atmosphere then this would be a safe place to go.View more

We tagged along with a friend & his wife, who are regulars at this highly acclaimed fine-dining Portuguese eatery. The decor features modern elements & classic Portuguese charm; I was particularly captivated by the stunning ceiling. My friend's wife gave "carte blanche" to the waiter to bring a selection of dishes for us to share, & he brought a few items from the Tapas Quentes: Pasteis de Bacalhau, Sardinhas Assadas, & Lulas Grelhadas. The sommelier paired a privately imported white wine with these tapas, a perfect match. Then, we were served Sela de Borrego along with the catch of the day, accompanied by another bottle of white wine harmoniously paired. Though I'm usually not a fan of white wine, I found myself thoroughly enjoying it, I drank my share & my wife's share. While some nice desserts were offered, I was too satiated to have any. Just before we left, a waitress came with a complimentary Porto. I surely found room for that. The service was top-notch, with multiple servers attending to our table, & the food was phenomenal. The bill was quite steep at the end of the night, but it was one of the most memorable meals we've had in a long time.View more

No doubt the food here is excellent: the oysters were perfectly complemented by the mignonette, scallops with sea urchin emulsion was buttery & luscious, & the confit canard was crispy while still being fall off the bone. We went on New Year's Day evening & these were standout dishes that we would definitely come back for. However, the cocktails & more importantly, the service was really where they dropped the ball. The cocktails were too dilute, like they were overmixed or otherwise let to stand too long so the ice has melted significantly & made them too watery. Our server was friendly enough, & he started us off well with a warm welcome, the menus, & specials. After that, he appeared to ignore our table for pretty much the whole meal. Different servers brought us water, wine, & our food while he was preoccupied with other tables. We thought it was because we were a party of two & he was just busy with the bigger tables he had, but then we noticed he was more attentive of other tables with parties of two (for example, two other couples were seated after us, & they received their bread & butter without asking within minutes of being seated, whereas we waited around 30 minutes for bread service & had to ask the server that brought our wine for it--it came just as our appetizer was dropped). Throughout our mains, we did not get so much as a check-in, a re-pour of wine, or a top-up of water. We were not asked if we wanted to order more wine while the couples beside us & the family behind us got multiple check-ins. When our dessert came, we also didn't get a check-in. When we asked for the bill, it took close to ten minutes to get it while he was attending to other tables, topping up their wines & waters. Overall, it was a pretty disappointing service experience especially since we were visiting the city & were really excited to try out the restaurant. We were at a loss as to why it went downhill so quickly while others appeared to have decent service. Was it because we are a queer couple that did not speak French? The place was busy but it didn't feel slammed to warrant how we were neglected. Either way, the food was quite impressive but we would be wary of returning because of the service especially with the amount we spent (& we could have spent more).View more

Amazing spot! Super lively & fun. First off the set up of this place is a huge bar in the middle & bar seating all around the bar & seating against the wall. There is no traditional seating it is all bar stools. This was maybe one of the very few downsides of the place, if you wanted to kind of relax & have a seat back you wont have that luxury. The drinks were super interesting & delicious. The negroni was different & you could really taste the coffee flavour in there. The maraycun sour (pisco sour with passion fruit) was really nice & tarty. The staff was helpful & really gave you a lay of the land regarding the menu. The suggestion was about 4-5 dishes for 2 people which was reasonable. The yucca fries are a MUST get. SUPER DUPER DELICIOUS. The vegetable dumplings, also very nice, maybe could have been filled a little better. The cheese empanadas were just okay, not great, not bad. On the meat side the octopus was really nicely made & had a great flavour & the chicarron dish was super tasty & filling. The one thing I would not suggest is the donut dessert. Honestly not great. They shouldn't have it on the menu. It tastes like nothing. We left it on the table after a few bites. The donut itself was tasteless & it was drenched in this very flowy sugar syrup. So its not like the syrup even permeated the donut. It was really terrible, but everything else was amazing.View more

One of my favorite restaurants in Montreal, Restaurant les Belles-Soeurs has it all. Located on sleepy & quaint rue Marie-Anne, this cute, unpretentious spot serves a delicious mix of North American diner food & French classics. My friend & I started with the escargot gratin, then each got a burger trio (burger, fries, salad, & a beer for around $20) & finished off with a pudding ch√¥meur. Everything was fresh & delicious - perfect comfort food to nourish the soul. The ambience is perfect since it was warm, we sat at a table outside, while a speaker played some relaxing jazz piano music. However, I have also visited with my girlfriend in winter, where we enjoyed the cozy interior. A bonus is the aquatic themed bathroom, which is totally unexpected, but fun nonetheless. The staff is incredibly kind as well, & they were able to accommodate my friend's sesame allergy by letting him bring his own burger bun. This place really is the definition of a hidden gem. Whether you live in Montreal year-round or are visiting, I would highly recommend paying a trip to Restaurant les Belles-SoeursView more

We came on a Monday (during holiday season) & we usually come for the brunch (which is only offered on weekends). Since it was during the holidays I thought they might be offering the brunch (wishful thinking). So this review is for their non brunch menu. Anyways, the dishes we ordered: chicken tikka tandoori- it was super tender & beautifully presented, the Lamb Kashmiri - super flavourful & the malai kofta was like an Indian style gnocchi- I found the sauce to be creamy but not so spicy/flavorful but this was more a dish for my daughter. The cheese naan was great too. Service was attentive, our water was filled without asking & she checked in on us every once in awhile. The decor at this location is so colourful & love the high ceilings. Overall just a great classy place. It is a bit on the high price for Indian food. But with great service & ambiance it's worth it. The service & atmosphere 10/10. Waiter was well-informed & the chef's seemed very competent! Not all every sushi piece was great but overall, it is a good-tasting sushi restaurant. I am not sure how fresh their ingredients were for the 5pm sitting but immediately after leaving the restaurant, I could feel that the food was not going to sit well. Food poisoning? I'm sure you can fill in the blanks of what happened as soon as I got home. I've eaten at numerous sushi restaurants all over Japan & at fish markets as well; never had this kind of stomach upset at an somewhat middle/high-end restaurant. The rooftop bar had a pleasant atmosphere, & our waitress was friendly & welcoming. However, the experience was marred by a significant bee problem-one bee even died in one of our cocktails, & another got trapped in a different drink. When the manager noticed an issue, he initially approached the table next to us rather than directly addressing ours, despite the visible problem we were experiencing. When he eventually inquired if everything was okay, we raised our concerns about the bee situation. Instead of taking responsibility or offering any meaningful assistance, he responded in a condescending tone, as though it wasn't his fault & he couldn't do anything to improve the situation. The manager's lack of engagement was disappointing; he appeared more attentive to other tables, particularly those with white patrons, while showing no initiative to resolve the issue at our table. When we politely requested to switch tables to an area with fewer bees, he dismissed the idea, insisting that the bees would still follow us, which was clearly inaccurate based on other areas in the bar. His attitude was not only arrogant & downright negligent but also displayed a concerning lack of understanding about the potential health risks associated with bee stings, especially for patrons who may have severe allergies. His dismissive & indifferent approach toward our experience reflected poorly on the establishment's overall service.View more

We went there my son & I last night for dinner around 8:30 & showed up 15 minutes late but there was no issue they gave us a table right away now the table we got was against the small separating wall in the corner so between the front window & their kitchen & we were against the small wall in the corner so like literally in the corner so as far as seating it wasn't that great but everything else was good. We were served by Jesse & found him serviceable & polite. He remembered to bring everything we asked for & more. They are lucky to have him working there, oh & Jesse also bragged about their head chef on how he was a "real superstar" who is one of the reasons we went there to begin with. My son saw cooking videos of the chef on TikTok & said "he really looks like a chef, the kind you'd see in a movie" & he claimed the cooking skills he filmed on TT were impressive. So we went to try it & it was really good we had the pizza with Italian sausage & pepperoni & it was a 12-in I believe it was way too much for me but it was delicious we just couldn't stop eating it was like a drug it was so good honestly worth going so you're not sure where to go tonight take a drive there on Gouin Blvd in Pierrefonds I will leave the address at the end but take the time You're not sure where to go you want a pizza you want pasta you want a steak you want some chicken you want some veal you want some amazing appetizers we had the calamari & it was the best we've had & I'm not just saying that I'm honest on my reviews seeing Im a local guide level 7 with almost 1 million views of my comments & I will always speak accurately, this place is highly rated & there's a reason for it if you have a chance go look at the videos on TikTok just put Vivaldi & you'll see the chef doing his thing & whatever you do try is hot jardiniere if you're a spicy food amateur will love it anyways the food was super fresh the service was super good Jesse was amazing, the place it was very busy with people everywhere & it was very good, I highly recommend it & don't forget to leave a review be honest I left a couple of pictures so you can look at their pizza & the calamari & like I said it's worth it to try it. So don't wait get up get out ask your mother your sister your brother your father your neighbor your co-worker the stranger on the street to go out & eat & try this place out you will love it so don't hesitate don't procrastinate Go try this & if you happen to be in Jesse's section you're going to find the service amazing as well as the food so there's no reason for you not to get up & go try it, here's the address, go tonight!! 13085 Blvd. Gouin O., PierrefondsView more

Went there for a supper last month & was very disappointed considering the price of things. I'll start off by saying the Tuscan Onion Soup was delicious, & that was the only good I ate that night. Had the Salmon tartare as an entree, & boy was it missing any taste. Needed some acidity to help give it some flavor, be it a type of vinegar or even some lemon/lemon zest & it definitely needed some salt. A little piece of advice, don't have a small slice of Avocado all the way at the bottom. Either puree it & layer that as you build the tartare or have it diced & mixed in before plating. No idea why it's sitting at the bottom like that. For the main course I had the Herb Salmon plate, that came with some veggies. Once again, the salmon just tasted like salmon... nothing to appease the palette. & the veggies? A small yellow pepper, whole with seeds & everything, that a single vague grill line & was completely cold. A stick of carrot not really peeled, also barley cooked & was cold just like the others. A 1/3 of a piece of cucumber, once again cold. & the broccoli was in the same sorry state. Either grill them or steam them, or better yet have a nice selection of veggies saut√© with a sauce that you can also baste the salmon with to give it some much needed flavor! Maybe if some of these things were reworked through in the kitchen, I'd consider giving it another chance.View more

We came here on Friday December 20th in the early evening & ordered to go. The place was empty - we initially wanted to order online but noticed the menu was different, less selection, so came in person. We tried one of their smashburgers & a poutine which featured cheese curds, as well as cheddar cheese, green onions & sour cream. The food was delicious but my only complaint is the very small portion size & high price. The burger by itself is over $10 & is super thin - I understand the concept of smash burgers but was surprised it did not come with fries or a drink for that price. The poutine I chose was a "regular" size but felt like a small. The food is also packaged in these cardboard take out boxes which are not lined or waxed so unfortunately most of the sauce absorbs through the paper. There are lots of different container options such as alimunium or waxed cardboard that can be used which would be a more ideal choice especially for poutine. This is just bad planning.View more

I would like to thank the manager at Hilton Garden Inn for helping me out with what was a tough situation. Daniel T. merci beaucoup, vous etes tres gentille & sympatique. I was visiting Montreal to be of support to a family member who was undergoing a serious operation. My room was huge & amazing, & for someone who usually stays at air bnbs, it was my first good lodging experience in the city as a tourist (bnbs in Mtl really suck compared to other towns & cities). Upon waking up the next day I realized that I had contracted a cold & sore throat & would absolutely not be able to be anywhere near this person I had come to support; before or after their operation. Hotel policy states that you cannot cancel at this point of your stay, but there was no reason for me to stay the rest of the week (which was my original plan). I spoke with Daniel, not really expecting him to be able to do anything, & once I had explained the situation, he took care of it with no hesitation. This kind of compassionate human interaction should be applauded, & more venues in Montreal should finally start to adopt this type of customer first/ human first approach towards guests, which I hate to say is not quite yet what Montreal (my home town) is known for. This type of service would create trust & attract way more tourists to this city which I still love very much. I have seen a better way, & so has Daniel T - again thank you for your compassion my friend! I can't wait to come back & stay with you in better times!View more

Even though I wasn't particularly hungry, every dish completely won me over! It wasn't just me-my companions, & even the people at the next table, kept exclaiming: "Wow, C'est tellement d√©licieux! C'est vraiment, vraiment bon!" I glanced over & noticed that their dishes were different from ours. We exchanged smiles, both clearly impressed! First Dish: Beef Tartare The highlight was how beautifully the flavors came together-the cheese, onion, mint, pomegranate, sweet vinegar, & beef blended so harmoniously! Each element had its distinct taste while perfectly complementing the others. It felt very Arabian & incredibly unique! Second Dish: Tomahawk Lamb Chops One bite & I was hooked-this is exactly what lamb chops should taste like! So authentically Middle Eastern & absolutely delicious. The smoky charcoal aroma mingled with spices, & the meat was perfectly balanced between lean & fatty. I couldn't resist picking it up with my hands to savor every bite! Third Dish: Dessert We ordered a random dessert, & it blew me away! I'm not a fan of desserts, but I didn't leave a single bite of this one. From the first spoonful, the cream melted in my mouth-cool but not icy, rich but not heavy. Then came an explosion of orange blossom & jasmine fragrances, so aromatic that I felt like I'd been transported to the garden of an Arabian palace. The base was light & crisp, layered with pistachio paste & nuts, delicate & flavorful. It was truly incredible! Lastly, a big shoutout to our server, Pamela, who was attentive & warm throughout the meal. Her excellent service made our dining experience even more delightful.View more

She tells us that the dj is gone so there will be no happy birthday song, I told her why she didn't tell us that earlier, we would've done it right after appetizer, while I'm still talking she walks away saying she will get manager & I told her no need but he still came. He comes & says that apparently I should've told manager I wanted a birthday song for her, & that it's on us because we should've known live dj is 5-10pm. I told him that we didn't know & then he was very defensive & I told him we're not on the same page & that we should leave this topic. He tried to still talk but it felt like I was talking to a wall. At the end they bring the cake & it was not nice the way they did, they dropped it off while the birthday person was about getting off her seat so half sparkler gone. It was just not good service & i wouldn't recommend it.View more

By far the best vegan restaurant in Montreal! My boyfriend & I have tried many vegan restaurants over the years but none compare to sham! First of all the service is great, the employees are super sweet & cater to all your needs & questions. The food is incredible. So flavourful, fresh & good portions! We have come for supper & breakfast & we will for sure be coming back time & time again! My favourite thing to order is the lemon mint juice it is so fresh & delicious! The egg burger has a tasty sauce inside that gives a wonderful flavour to the mushrooms & onions, & the white sauce that is served on the side of the tots is so creamy! The pancakes are nice & crunchy on the outside & fluffy in the middle. The omelette tastes just like real egg but is very light! The shami kebabs are definitely something you need to try, such amazing flavour. All in all 10/10 across the board!View more

The tables are sufficiently spaced - The level of background music is in good taste- so you can spend a very nice time with friends while enjoying excellent sushi & other Japanese specialties. The staff is very attentive to your customer's needs. That is the best place in the West Island to eat great sushi & invite friends. Prices have increased as everywhere else, but they reasonably increased & the high quality of food & service as well justify this increase - The same thing cannot be said of other restaurants (sushi or else) where the bill is enormously increased without improving neither the quality of meals nor the service. & when these places have INCREASED the bill a little bit, they have greatly REDUCED the quality of meals, the quantity of what is in your plate & the service. Do the math & you'll understand what is reasonable & what is not.View more

So a time at Randolphs is always fun. No matter the service, or food, or location of the place, you make your own fun with the people you bring & the games you play. Unfortunately when I went with a group of people yesterday, we had less fun than we normally would. This is the first time we go to this location as usually we either go to Laval or Ste Catherine, but yesterday this location was most convenient for all of us. To begin, one of my friends ordered chicken tenders, & there were two hairs in the first five bites of her salad. She sent it back & wanted a new one, but she never got the replacement. Then, when I ordered my second drink, half an hour went by before our waitress came back, she saw me & told me my drink was on the way, took everyone else's order & left. Then when she came back, she came back with everyone's drink but mine. She then disappears for about ten minutes & we ask someone to track her down for us cause someone wanted food with their drink, & she couldn't be found. When a different waitress came to our table & brought everyone's food i commented that I would like my drink canceled cause it's been too long at this point & I dont want it anymore. It took me saying that for my waitress to actually come bring me my drink. During our first two hours, our waitress was absolutely nowhere to be seen & only came back to our table when we flagged her down or sent someone on a wild goose chase after her. During our last hour, after she had to comp two items from our bill, suddenly she knew how to waitress & was able to come by a couple times to ask if everything was alright. The food, & the service were both honestly disappointing compared to the level of service & taste we are used to when going to Randolph, I honestly would not come back to this location if I know I'll be getting multiple rounds of drinks & food. The game masters were really sweet & helpful, they definitely were the saviors of that evening.View more

I work at the airport & had a craving for a proper breakfast - I saw that this restaurant offered one so I headed there shortly after it opened, around 0630H I will never order the breakfast ever again. The''CLASSIC AMERICAN BREAKFAST'' either comes with 1 or 2 eggs - 1 egg is 19$, 2 eggs is 25$ (6 extra dollars for an extra EGG?) Furthermore, you have the option to go for sausages OR bacon - not both, that's extra. So I went with 2 eggs, chose the sausages, but asked for extra bacon - it cost me 34$ (with taxes) Now, I understand it is a''fancy'' restaurant - but the quality wasn't there either. - 2 tiny eggs - The sausages weren't complete portions - The slices of fruits were absolutely thin & inadequately cut from their peel (so some loss of edible fruit flesh) - The bread was super cheap bread that you can find at any dollar store - & not buttered! - In terms of flavour, very bland too - the potato portion had no flavour All in all, - The quantity is not reasonably proportional to the price - The QUALITY is not at all reasonably proportional to the price None of this meal is worth 34$ - & even if I didn't go with the extra bacon it was at least 27.49$ (if you go with 2 eggs) which is outrageously expensive - if at least it was satisfying or great tasting, I would've been a bit more''okay'' with that price, but I really can NOT recommend this place for breakfast. That said, the establishment was clean as always (although I did see a small mouse on my way to the restaurant, as it is in an airport) & the staff was friendly, courteous & politeView more

It is cliche to say "Never judge a book by its cover", but this holds true for one of Montreal's hidden gems. Cafe Solaris attributes its pride in the quality of ingredients it uses rather than its flash on its front entrance. Yes! A typical looking walk-in cafe with down to Earth "Joes" making a true living & patrons smile. You are family the minute you walk through the door. But the real reason you come is because you know you will revel in an authentic meal, whether it be a ravishing thin crust pizza tailored to your liking, ciabatta hoagies that explode with freshness & just the right amount of crunch, or one of their gargantuan salads that leave you craving your veggies. That being said, I'd still go with the Goose Basket (a specialty gem, featuring grilled chicken & Italian sausage in a fresh salad mixture..... Yes... You read correctly - sausage in a salad). The decor is not overly fancy &... But the service, hospitality, & fully fresh lunch & dinner menu far outweigh & out match any fine eatery in the city... On top of that, you won't be burning any holes in your wallet. The two partners (Giovanni & Roberto) will ensure you come back for more again & again. It's a winner.View more

My visit to this bar was a departure from my usual haunts, which was a refreshing change. I attended a work event & we reserved a section near the entrance. The ambiance is that of a casual hangout spot; nothing too fancy, so no need to dress up. The layout includes a terrace & a basement bar accessed via stairs. Drinks are reasonably priced, with beers going for around $8. While my vodka Redbull was a bit weak on the alcohol content, the Saint-Germain spritz & Moscow mule were decent choices. I'd recommend sticking to beer here. Most people mainly ordered burgers & fries, served generously. The music started off poorly but improved as the night went on (commerical/mainstream music). They also had basketball games playing on the TVs, which was a nice touch. Street parking is available nearby. The service at the bar was excellent; the bartender was friendly & quick to serve our drinks. However, the table service was a bit lacking, with the waitress being somewhat slow. Overall, a decent spot for a casual night out.View more

We ordered the hot plates a bit before being sat at our table, & the food arrived almost at 10pm. I hate leaving bad reviews but I need to vent. I treated myself to the Christmas Table d'H√¥te by reservation only, for which I had to pre-pay. My 1st gripe - they charged 20% service instead of the standard 15%. I would not have cared had the evening been perfect & for $210+, I had high expectations. ($250+ actually, because I ordered bread & 2 drinks) But alas... It started off pretty basic - an amuse served on a p√¢te sabl√© (like every other tasting menu this season) followed by scallops followed by the rack of lamb. & that is where everything fell apart. Firstly, they served the rack whole - 4 bones. It looked impressive & had my last name been Flintstone, I would have rejoiced. But as I am not a cartoon, I had to grab the bones with my hands to try & cut through the chops to make the rest of the carving manageable. After struggling with the darn thing & accidentally flinging 2 mushrooms into my lap, I asked my waiter Pierre, whose excellent service saved this review from being 1 star, to have the kitchen cut it for me. When he returned, what I found in my plate was 1 chop, 1/2 chop & 2 bones with nothing but fat & gristle. (do they not know how to properly trim a rack of lamb?) Did I mention I paid $210 for this meal? So I asked another waiter - Veronique, also lovely - what happened to the rest of the meat? She sent the maitre D to me who had nothing more to say than it was the standard portion (not true - everybody else was served 3 full chops with the extra bone for decor) but finally offered to see if there was a larger piece in the kitchen. I refused to send my plate back again (can you blame me?) so I ate what they served. But I can't help wonder why they singled me out for that piece. In the end, I felt disrespected & it ruined my whole experience. This is yet another over-priced restaurant serving the same food as every other high-end eatery in the city with little to recommend it over anywhere else less pricey. Lesson learned, at least.View more

My wife & I used to go to this restaurant often before we had our son so this was not our first time. However it was the first time in a while because they were closed at this location for a lot of the spring. Anyway my wife & I took our 16 month old son there this past Friday evening. The service & food was amazing as always. When we first arrived they had a little trouble finding a high chair for our son but I really appreciate that one of the people working there went out of his way to make sure we got our high chair, even checking their sister restaurant next door. There was a deal on drinks (we got some Aperol Spritz's) & they had a kids menu which was perfect for our son (things like pizza, etc). The foccacia appetizer was great, we were expecting bread with oil but it was closer to a garlic bread pizza (came out of the pizza oven) & was much larger than expected. My wife got the funghi pasta which she LOVED & I got the seafood linguine (with salmon & shrimp). We sat inside, which was fairly quiet, food came fast even though their terrace was packed, & the waitress brought a coloring book for our son to keep him entertained till the food arrived. Was always a nice place for a date (as I mentioned we used to go a lot before our son was born) but also great for a family dinner as well. Very highly recommend.View more

The restaurant is quite popular, so we made a reservation well in advance. The food was beautifully presented, but the flavors didn't quite match the hype. The foie gras, a highly recommended dish, was overly greasy, though the flavor was decent. The bagel was a bit tough to chew. One practical issue we noticed was that the plates slid around on the marble table while we were eating; some tablecloths could have easily addressed this. Unfortunately, there were a few service-related mishaps. A server accidentally spilled water on my mom's phone-these things happen, & we didn't make a fuss-but the most disappointing aspect was the long wait. We sat for nearly an hour before our orders were served. What was odd, however, was that all of our dishes appeared right after we inquired about them. This left us wondering if the food had been sitting out, as some dishes were lukewarm by the time they reached our table. As for the atmosphere, while the space is beautifully decorated, the busyness detracts from the overall experience. The tables are packed so tightly that it feels overcrowded, which not only diminishes the ambiance but likely overwhelms the staff as well. Perhaps this explains the delays in service. Given the high price point of the menu, I'd imagine the restaurant could afford to reduce the number of tables & create a more refined & enjoyable dining experience. Overall, while the restaurant excels in appearances, it seems to fall short on delivering substance. We had high expectations for this meal, but the experience was ultimately underwhelming.View more

What a unique culinary experience of an underrepresented cuisine - modern Caribbean. Delicious & wonderfully spiced dishes. We had the hummus, shrimp & braised pork to start, absolutely delicious, the pork was so tender & paired very well with the plantain fritters & vinegar coleslaw. Mains consisted of vegetable curry, jerk chicken & the lamb shank, all seasoned to perfection & comforting, I really felt the love. Do yourself a favour & order the sweet potato dessert, a mix between pumpkin pie & spice cake, perfect for fall & winter. Coffee with coconut milk & rum is a must. Friendly, courteous & quick service in a cozy & homey atmosphere, music not too loud (this is a pet peeve of mine & this place absolutely passed the test). Even though the restaurant was full, there was a nice calm vibe throughout the entire service. The owner came to our table & chatted with us which is always a nice touch, definitely recommend for an intimate dinning exp√©rience.View more

The decor of the restaurant is quite pleasant, following a long narrow path of banquet seating on one side & a lush bar on the opposite side; it provided a nice respite from a cold winter night. What a wonderful dining experience I enjoyed this evening for my first visit to this restaurant! Firstly I must say we were warmly greeted by Suzanne. We were seated at a lovely waterfront table. Service was friendly & prompt. Suzanne recommended our wine & we began our very pleasurable dining experience. We started with bread & cheese fondue. The amounts were perfect, as space must be allowed for the rest of the meal. I so enjoyed my Caesar salad, again very delicious & perfectly portioned. The scallops & shrimp were large & we were instructed to cook them for 45 seconds only, with 5 sauces to accompany them. Our evening finished with chocolate fondue with strawberries & bananas. The entire evening was very pleasurable. Fondue is meant to last for a few hours & enjoyed with space between courses. I highly recommend this restaurant. The food was perfectly prepared by Suzanne's husband. Truly a labour of love for this couple who own & operate. Clearly young people who are used to fast food joints, will not appreciate such a fine dining experience. I will definitely return & thank Suzanne & her husband for a wonderful dining experience.

Or dining experience at this restaurant was bad right from the start. We had a group reservation for 14 people. When we showed up, they said they didn't have it. Luckily, restaurant was almost empty (this was a Friday night) so we were seated anyway. When came time to order, I ordered the bavette. The waiter had to go check with the kitchen if they had it. The first three people in our group ordered meat dishes. & after that, they were out of meat. Early on a Friday night, they were out... They forgot to bring an appetizer, didn't ask if we needed another glass of wine. Waiters were spending time chatting with eachother in the other room near the bar... Just very average all night long. & then, when it came time to pay, they told us they were adding an 18% service charge because of the size of the group. That was stated on the menu so I guess they're allowed... But after such appalling service, to be charged that much left a bitter taste in my mouth. I felt in an episode of Fawlty towers.View more

When our food got to the table, it took the staff about 10 minutes (& about 2 minutes after we started eating) to realize that one of the pizzas that was supposed to be given to someone else at the table was actually given to two people intending to share a single pizza. We ended up paying for this error by the staff, as it wasn't clear that "are you alright with this" meant "are you alright with getting charged with a second pizza" & not "are you alright with getting more food on accident & making your friend wait longer." Perhaps just a misinterpretation on our part, but still a bit disappointing to see on the bill. Service was overall slow & lackluster. The restaurant must have been 50-66% full & it must have been about 1 hour to get our food. We were a larger group at 10 people yes, but even for that I feel the wait was a bit long. Food quality was also not that great. I had a Margherita pizza, which even for "just" a cheese pizza was a bit lacking in flavor. Service was overall pleasant. Staff were nice. Take it from a local: Montreal is a great city for food. If you're willing to walk 5-10 minutes in any direction, you'll find food that's better quality, for a comparable price or even less than La Palma.View more

La Serenata is a gem in the realm of Italian dining, offering an unforgettable experience that resonates with both the palate & the spirit. I had the pleasure of attending my nieces Sophia's sons baptism dinner at this remarkable restaurant, & it truly exceeded all expectations. From the moment we arrived, the ambiance enveloped us in warmth & charm. The decor strikes a perfect balance between traditional Italian elegance & modern comfort, creating an inviting atmosphere ideal for family gatherings & special occasions. The staff greeted us with genuine smiles, setting the tone for an evening filled with superb service. In addition to the exquisite food, the service at La Serenata was exceptional. The staff was attentive without being intrusive, ensuring that our glasses were never empty & that we had everything we needed to enjoy our meal. Their knowledge of the menu was evident, as they provided thoughtful recommendations that enhanced our dining experience. Overall, La Serenata is more than just a restaurant; it's a place where culinary passion meets heartfelt hospitality. The combination of outstanding food & impeccable service makes it a perfect choice for any celebration, including my niece's son's baptism. I wholeheartedly recommend La Serenata to anyone seeking a memorable Italian dining experience that leaves a lasting impression.View more

Ended up at this place because of my friend's recommendation. She's been to this pizzeria before & thought their pizza is amazing so she took me here during our Montr√©al trip. The place was busy when we went for a visit during peak lunch hour rush on a Thursday. There was even quite a long line forming outside the restaurant of people waiting for a table. We ended up waiting for about 15 minutes or so before getting a table. The waiting time wasn't too bad to be honest. & if you don't want to wait, you can always order to go & eat it at the park across the street. What we ordered: ??? Caesar Salad ??? 8.5/10 The salad was fresh & nicely seasoned. Not too salty or peppery or cheesy. Very balanced. The portion was quite generous too. ??? No.23 Campagnola ??? 9.5/10 Sauce, mushrooms, onions, spicy pancetta (Italian bacon), mozzarella, black olives. I have to say this was probably one of the best pizza I've ever had in recent times. The pizza was cooked really well with that wood burning aroma whiffing off of the crust that's slightly charred on different spots. The texture was nice, chewy & there's a slight bounce to the bite. All the toppings were also evenly cooked & sitting nicely on top of the gooey mozzarella & the portion is quite big & generous. ??? No.68 A La Griglia ??? 9/10 Fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, grilled vegetables (zucchini, eggplant, onions, artichokes, mushrooms, green & red peppers), fresh garlic, Italian herbs, olive oil, Parmigiano-Reggiano. My friend actually ordered this one & I have the same comment about the overall pizza like the Campagnola. I think their pizza is really solid & you can just order whichever pizza that have the toppings that you like & I'm pretty sure you'll enjoy it. Definitely will go back again the next time I'm in Montr√©alView more

I almost gave this place 4 stars. A couple of small changes could boost my rating to 4 or even 5. Service - The only two people who appear to work the front of the house were wonderful. Friendly & helpful. The problem is, only one wait staff & one bartender... for the whole restaurant. So service, while pleasant, was very slow. I saw the same comment in other reviews. It doesn't appear to be an isolated incident. They just seem to be chronically understaffed. This needs to change. Food - Good, but given how slow the service was, we only made 1 order, so didn't try as much as we would have liked. Normally at an Izakaya we order at least 2, if not 3 rounds of food. Overall, nothing I tried was amazing, but again, what I sampled was limited. Cocktails were ok. Atmosphere - Nice, but we were seated at the back of the restaurant, & it seemed liek they ran out of lights or decorations before they got to the back. So those last few tables are a bit drab when compared to the rest of the restaurant. Also, the music only seems to play in front. Again, the back of the restaurant lacks atmosphere that you find in the rest of the place. Overall, I think this place has potential, & the staff are great. They just need to finish decorating & hire more servers. Then this place should be good. However, given how many good Izakayas there are in MTL, I won't likely be back to find out.View more

Cette lager au riz, servie dans une magnifique bouteille, √©tait savoureuse & repr√©sentait un excellent rapport qualit√©-prix. Le seul v√©ritable point n√©gatif concerne la carte des vins. Unlucky as we are, we were once again seated below the speakers which made the music a bit too loud for our comfort. Beside that though, we really adored the atmosphere including the liveliness & the glamorous interior design. Especially the way that the ceiling is incorporated in the design, it was quite unique & lovely. The food was amazing. The flavours were adventurous & the options were also great. I especially enjoyed their salted duck egg carbonara udon that had a great creamy texture with an amazing balance of sweetness & saltiness. The other plates were also great but I wasn't a big fan of the peanut butter flavours in their beef noodles. I can see why people like it, but it was just not my thing. I really admire their concept of elevating Chinese Cuisine to a type of fine dining experience, especially while keeping the familiarity of sharing dishes. However, I still feel like the portions are way too small for the prices they charge. Each plate is around 20$ & the portions are just too small in my opinion. That is particularly true for the shrimp dumplings that are 16$ for 4 pieces. The dumplings were good, but still very expensive. The service was fantastic. Everyone was friendly, cheerful & patient. We had an amazing time but it did take some time before we got our drinks & the food also took some time before it was served.View more

[Update 2024-nov] downgraded 1 star (4 to 3). The portions got smaller & the prices higher. The wait time for food was really long even though we came at 17h30. The drinks are ok. Overall, it's still ok if you want fusion cantonese food & a great ambiance for a night out with a group = dj was great. [DINNER REVIEW] Came here for dinner with friends on a Saturday night. Reservation was made easy with OpenTable online, you get a confirmation & everything : we reserved for 7pm & we were seated right away. It's still new (opened in Dec 2021), the service was excellent & the waitress that we had was courteous & informative about the menu. Speaking of which, the menu was small, only a dozen items but I expect them to add more choice as time goes on when their business grows. The food was good : the Bang Bang chicken & its sauce were excellent as well as the salted egg carbonara. If you've never had jellyfish, you should try their jellyfish & chicken dish (presented like a cold salad). Nonetheless, we thought that some dishes could be better : the fried calamari were soggy & lacking, the sauce in the longevity noodles were overly sweet & the Peking duck a bit on the pricey side (35$+tx) for 10 slices of duck. The cocktails, although pretty & Instagram-worthy, were very expensive (16$+tx). Instead, we chose their Hong Kong Milk tea & Lemon tea to quench our thirst & we were satisfied with our choices. Overall, it is a nice restaurant for outings & casual high end fusion Cantonese food. I wouldn't mind coming back here with family, with a date or with friends to spend a fun foodie evening.View more

I have been a regular patron of this restaurant since 2010. During a recent visit I had a subpar experience on several levels, however. Without going into detail, the restaurant was clearly having a very bad night. I had a talk with the management about my experience & they acknowledged the problem & accepted full responsibility. When you pay a certain price for something it is normal to have a reasonable expectation of standards & quality. When that is what you get you know nothing more. It is when something goes wrong & needs to be addressed that you truly find out who you are dealing with. In reflecting on the experience & the response I received it is abundantly clear that even after all these years Maiko Sushi cares a great deal about remaining a top provider. We had such an exquisite dinner at this restaurant. The seafood was fresh & of great quality & the rice had a well balanced vinegary taste to it which made the sushi taste amazing while not overpowering the flavours of the other ingredients. The soya sauce was also delicious, a nice balance between sweet & salty which added onto the experience. The service was also great. The waiter was patient, friendly & quite polite which made the evening more enjoyable. Please do note that it did take us around an hour after we sat down at our table to get our food. The little things that did take us out a bit during the meal was probably the ceiling with all the ventilation running through that can be easily seen & the loudness of the music. Even though there were already a lot of customers talking, the loud music made it even harder to speak with each other at our own table. Finally, the price was a bit high in my opinion. It was 130$ for the omakase set for 2 people & 260$ for 4. I don't mind paying more but I would have loved to see a couple of sushi with some more expensive cuts like fatty tuna or scallops. We mostly only got rolls which felt a bit more boring to me but they still tasted great. The lobster dish though was quite adventurous & exquisite in taste which was refreshing in the meal.View more
